Reviews.Title: “Fine stay over St. Patrick's Day weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tazaemon
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago with a group of friends for some St. Patrick's Day festivities, and see a few sights along the way. The hotel has a terrific location being on Ontario Street just steps east of Michigan Ave (or the Magnificent Mile). It is conveniently located nearby the Hancock Tower, many deep dish pizza establishments (GIno's East, Uno, Due, Lou Malnati's), upscale shopping, the Chicago River and for popcorn lover's, Garrett's is located at the base of the building (always a line-up). There are numerous other restaurants in the immediate vicinity that will satisfy every taste. Also within walking distance is the southern business district with much of the great architecture, Millennium Park (where you'll find Cloud Gate - a mesmerizing mirror bean-shaped sculpture). The hotel is very close to beaches and the Navy Pier as well. The lobby is rather underwhelming and small. Perhaps I tend to think of city hotels as all having great lobbies, but this Marriott hardly felt like a hotel at all when I entered. Nevertheless, the service was very good and I all was taken care of in a timely manner. There were no problems. Our room was located on the 21st floor. Now, the elevators at ground level always seem to be easy to catch, but going down there could be upwards of a 5 minute wait. The room itself was clean, beds comfortable, mini-fridge, $6 Evian bottled water (bring your own!), TV, view of the city etc. Certainly sufficient. However it does look like every other hotel room of its kind and is hardly original. But really, with so much to do during the day and night, time spent in the hotel room should be a minimum. Our hotel room was cleaned regularly. Any questions we had were answered and therefore, I certainly had no issues with service in the hotel. Parking is within the building and is a public parking lot. It is pricey at more than $40 per day. But the parking garage does not have a creepy vibe and feels quite safe. The area where the hotel is located is very safe - hardly a dangerous area of Chicago. There is no continental breakfast here, so visitors must venture out for their breakfast. The hotel has a pool and an above average gym on the 10th floor. I must add that we did deal with a concierge named Lauren who was absolutely wonderful in helping us out. She definitely went out of her way to ensure we got to where we were going and provided some terrific insight. The hotel room was more than $200 a night, but I was in downtown Chicago and did not need to drive anywhere once I arrived. Plus all the major sights are very close. The hotel does lack any architectural appeal, so for those who need to feel like they're in 1920s Chicago, for instance, should look elsewhere. It is generally a great place for those who want to crash in a comfortable place and like to get out an explore the city with all major attractions at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised....”
Reviews.Author: sophiegirl04
Reviews.Content: Courtyard is not my favorite Marriott brand, so was not looking forward to staying here - but glad that I did. A reasonably priced option 1 block off of the Miracle Mile, Starbucks in lobby, Dunkin Donuts across the street, and Capital Grill and Lux Cafe up the block. Of course shopping is just a few steps away - within one block is Forever 21, Nordstroms, and Home Goods - all price ranges for all pocketbooks. Oh, and don't forget Garretts next door! Check in staff was pleasant, also all front end personnel. Room was a normal size, somewhat surprising for the price and in the city - was expecting a cubicle! Marriott clean, nice marble bath, with sink outside of toilet area...so much easier than when it is all in one. AC was not working correctly when I arrived, and was corrected within 15 minutes. (and when is AC even needed in March in Chicago!) Internet speed was good, elevators were fast (I was on 18), and keys consistently worked. I would be surprised to find a better value in this area, and will definitely return. Why not a 5 star? - I hate paper cups and that horrible in room coffee service...along with cheapo toiletries. Other than that - this is a decent hotel, and when you factor in the price - well above average. And since I spend 100+ nights in a hotel...........

Reviews.Title: “2nd Trip. VERY Disappointed. Would try a different place.”
Reviews.Author: NyTravelinMan14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for the Marriott brand and location while working at a trade show for a week. Last year, it was a great experience overall. Last week was a DISASTER. The bellman, concierge and front desk staff are all very polite. That has not changed. A few of the waitstaff in the restaurant are exceptional as well. BUT, that is where it all ends. The bed is like sleeping on a brick. The pillows are uncomfortable. I had requested a mini refrigerator and foam pillows when making the reservation (verbal confirmation to my written request), but had to call down to the desk, as they had not been provided. TWO days, the room was NEVER touched. No cleaning, no replenishment of towels, toiletries, coffee, etc. I was out of the room from 7am until 10pm! NO excuses. I complained and the first night I was given 3,000 points in my account, an apology and offer to come clean the room (at that point 10:30pm) and a free cocktail in the bar if I waited downstairs for my room to be cleaned. I just asked for some towels and toiletries and went to bed. The second night they gave me a certificate for a free night, as it was already 11pm! I ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant one morning....what a mistake. My omlette and toast were burned. They took a while to be served as well. When I complained, they offered to make it again, but I had to leave for the trade show (I worked a booth). They still charged me! They took off 20%. I complained later to the front desk. They did not remove the charge. They gave me a coupon for a free breakfast that I never got to use :( Not enough? The elevators were quirky for 3 days and actually got stuck a few times for 5 minutes. next year, I think I am going to try a new location. There are plenty in the area in the same price range, some are better hotels. I was considering a weekend get-a-way here but not now.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: 230nmort
Reviews.Content: UNBELIEVABLE QUALITY FOR THE PRICE. Comfortable beds, clean, friendly service. This hotel is convenient to everything in the heart of downtown. It has a fabulous restaurant adjacent to it, as well. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: McLean4
Reviews.Content: Great location. Nice rooms. Remember, it's a Courtyard, not the Ritz. Got a great rate on Orbitz. Looked to have good dining options on-site, and of course lots of options withing walking distance. Only negatives: cheap towels in the rooms, and only average bedding. As a Marriott Gold, I did not get any special treatment, but for $99 during the weekday, it was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GburgfoodieQ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for business. I was worried about it being far from my office. It was about 3 miles down Michigan Avenue. I'm glad I rented a car. The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. The area is awesome with a lot of restaurants and shopping on every corner. Very safe for tourists. There is a Starbucks in the lobby for your convenience. The staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad4040
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this location and again it did not let me down. The price was reasonable and the location can't be beat. You are in the heart of the downtown area with tons to do. I will definitely stay here again when I'm back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the hotel staff. The front desk was outstanding as were the doormen. These people made you feel like dignitaries. I wish I could have tipped more generously. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel was very secure in regard to safety and it was also located close to many restaurants and shopping. The pool water was a bit cold but my young daughter certainly did not complain. Thanks again to the staff. You were all wonderful and deserve a raise. We'll see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dlpryor
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in Chicago for one night and really wanted to make the best of it. We couldn't have picked a better location. This hotel was right around the corner from Michigan Avenue. The shopping was great and the restaurant selection was plentiful. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The room was comfortable, clean, and quiet. The front desk and conceirge staff were fantastic. The staff bent over backwards to be helpful. I was regretting not staying another night until I came down to a lobby full of young adults (I assumed college kids) carrying cases of beer. They had just unloaded from a bus and had obviously been drinking all day. I overheard that they were from Columbia Missouri, in town for a golf banquet. One girl actually had to be carried into the hotel. She apparently had a few to many on the bus. I felt bad for the hotel staff having to deal with that ridiculousness and was glad to be on our way. I did turn to the concierge and ask how they handled situations like this and he said, "No worries. We have a zero tolerance policy and if they cause any trouble they will lose their rooms.". He sounded very convincing. I'm sure all hotels have to deal with situations like that from time to time. I would return to this hotel again for a fun girls trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: cktucker49328
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here for a mid-winter get away. There were 7 in our party altogether (including 2 senior citizens and 3 kids), and we had booked 2 rooms. Upon arrival, they informed us they had upgraded us to 2 separate adjoining rooms which gave us 4 rooms for the 7 of us but still charged us for the 2 rooms I had originally reserved. We had soooo much room! And the rooms were very nice with comfortable beds. The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was very nice and knowledgeable about the area. They were great with helping us get a van taxi since there were so many in our party, and they gave a great recommendation where to get the traditional Chicago-style deep dish pizza. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Lovetogo2011
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here for a mid-winter get-a-way. We were amazed by the level of service. Staff was very friendly. We especially want to thank Neil for his excellent advice to see the musical Million Dollar Quarter with half-price tickets. His recommendation to eat at the Weber Grill was perfect for what we wanted that night. The hotel was secure, the rooms very clean, and the restaurant was full-service and reasonably priced. We will definitely return to this perfectly located property. Be sure to stop next door at Garrett's for the world's greatest popcorn. The only downside--parking is expensive--but it is Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for business/trade shows”
Reviews.Author: ray s
Reviews.Content: We had over 150 room nights with our group there in late January, 2012 and it was great. It marked the fourth event we've had at the Courtyard and they've been awesome. Would highly recommend them, especially if you are in town for a tradeshow. But, I've stayed there non-work as well and the treatment was the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: I recently spent six days in Chicago for business/pleasure mix. The hotel service was fantastic! The onsite restaurant has a good menu, reasonably priced, with a breakfast buffet. Workout room was nice, never crowded, and I felt secure during my stay. The room blocked most of the noise, as I slept really well. There is a hospital three blocks away, so there are quite a few sirens, but not enough that I wouldn't stay here again. The only drawback was that my toilet would not flush properly, but maintenance fixed it quickly. Great follow up after my stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or personal stay”
Reviews.Author: ragingragnar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights for a series of business meetings. I found the hotel to be excellent in every department. I highly recommend it for business meetings, as the facilities and service was fantastic. The bedrooms were also spacious and very comfortable. Reception staff were attentive, and the location of the hotel was superb. I would definitely use this hotel again and it comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mingo05
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Courtyard Magnificent Mile for a girls shopping trip. The rooms were recently remodeled, comfortable and very clean. The service was wonderful! The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Kudos to Neil, our valet. He made our stay perfect. There is a Starbucks right off the lobby for convenient coffee in the morning. Garrett's popcorn is next door-a must if you haven't tried it. The Corner Bakery is a block away for a good, inexpensive breakfast or lunch. Try Francesca's on Chestnut for some wonderful Italian. The location is mid-Magnificent Mile and convenient to Nordstrom & the Bridge Shops as well as the Gold Goast & Watertower Place. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Chicago, and I must say, a very pleasant one. We were only there for 2 days but I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff were so friendly, our room very clean, spacious and comfortable, and the restaurant and bar equally as pleasing. I should say that the city of Chicago itself we found very welcoming as well, and if we ever find ourselves going back to this city, we will definitely stay here again. Thank you again for the hospitality and a great 1st time experience to your city. Well done. John & Laurie Demars

Reviews.Title: “Great location , good stay”
Reviews.Author: packslysol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to shopping, many great places to eat, and classic Chicago tourist musts. Check in went well and our high floor, away from the elevator room, was ready. The hotel was VERY crowed with holiday travelers. Our room was very clean however, the carpets were stained in serveral places. If you do have a room next to an elevator, you will hear it. The pool was small and the water was very 'salty' per some of the kids swimming in the pool. Nice workout room -open 24/7. A nice and average courtyard stay in a large city. We did use the valet. Both the valet and the doormen were very nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice!”
Reviews.Author: scottbizz
Reviews.Content: Just spent a night in Chicago at Courtyard on Ontario St. No it is not on Michigan Ave. but just 1 block east. Honestly it is in a great location, couple blocks from Water Tower Place, and other Mich Ave. shopping. Rooms were quite spacious, good amenities in bathroom, flat screen LG TV, bed very comfortable. They have a surprisingly good Bar/Restaraunt on site, Viand, and a Starbucks also. Garret's popcorn shop a few steps away (best Chicago Mix popcorn ever!) Very convenient parking attached, the fee was $30 for 24 hours, sounds high, but in downtown Chicago that's cheap! I have nothing negative to say about this Marriott property. Highly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay close to Magnificent Mile shopping”
Reviews.Author: TEShaffer
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend stay here with my girlfriend, room was terrific and clean. Since we had a later train ride home, the front desk gave us a later checkout and also watched our bags for the remaining time without us even asking. The staff here makes you feel at home. We will stay here again on our next trip to chicago. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Many good stays here”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirl2020
Reviews.Content: I stay here a lot and figured I would give an update to my first review which was basically useless. This hotel is in a great location. It is clean, modern and service is great. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper- the sound proofing in this hotel is not the best. You will ample road noise and sirens for the emergency room, you might also hear other guests talking or partying in rooms nearby. I will continue to stay here because it's walking distance of where I need to be. There is also a decent gym, but I could not find any disinfecting wipes for machines. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Donna4678
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this hotel a few times through the years. We returned for a quick trip to Chicago last week and our stay was very enjoyable. We were only there for one night, so we had very little luggage. There is a parking garage attached to the hotel, we parked ourselves, checked in, and headed out to shop. Michigan Avenue is only about a block away and the hotel is also close to fabulous restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful and our room was extremely comfortable. There is a Starbucks attached to the lobby area which is handy because we ate so much deep-dish pizza that we only needed coffee and a muffin for breakfast! The hotel is located in an area with a neighborhood feel to it. It is easy to run to the lake area for those who like to run or walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtavessuede
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here for a honeymoon. The property was great, room was clean and in great condition, staff was friendly and parking was convenient. We could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Very good !”
Reviews.Author: puertovallartafan
Reviews.Content: Great location ! In front of one of the best steakhouses of Chicago. Very friendly staff. A good Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed here last weekend and were very happy with our choice. Just one block from the holiday hustle and bustle on Michigan Ave, and a short walk to the Navy Pier. The staff was courteous and professional and Neil (bell staff) was superb! Our room on the 20th floor was cozy, clean and quiet. The hotel was busy over the weekend but we didn't experience any issues at all, not even with the elevators. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: clvier1
Reviews.Content: This property is just a block or two east of the Mag Mile, about halfway up the Mag Mile. Got a rate through Marriott of $109 for the Friday after Thanksgiving, which is a steal for anyplace in that location. Lots of things going for this property: 1) For comparable properties, cheap onsite parking (the first 9 stories of the hotel are parking) 2) Great location for shoppers and dining (Streeterville, River North, Mag Mile), and plenty of choices within a block or two in either direction. 3) Friendly bellhops, concierge, and front desk folks. 4) QUIET....did not hear a peep from the street (I was on 12th floor) or from people above, below, or next to me. 5) Rooms are tastefully decorated, comfortable, and clean. Appreciated the good lighting and comfortable chair and the desk chair too. 6) Viand, the restaurant next door, is a nice, attractive place for food and drink. An easy place to pass over in a city with thousands of restaurants, many of them worth going to. It was GREAT after a hectic Friday after Thanksgiving to pop in there (there is a door directly from the hotel) and have a nice drink or two with pleasant jazz going on the sound system and a nice quiet atmosphere. The breakfast there the next morning (I had the buffet) was very good, my server was excellent and I could see there were regulars there who come to the city aroudn the holiday, as well as locals. Only down side was at check out, it took a while to snag an elevator that had space for me. But, it is a busy travel weekend and the hotel was full, so this is a minor thing. Notes: There is a piano bar on the other side of the street, one block east, that looked fun. Ask the hotel for a 20% off coupon for Timothy O'Toole's, a sports bar two blocks east. Very good burgers and salads if you are looking for something quick and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ctottengarner
Reviews.Content: Planned a last minute getaway on one of the busiest weekends in downtown Chicago for my family (two adults, three children under the age of 5yrs) and was able to comfortably fit in a room with a King bed and Sofa bed. While I did experience a few "hang-ups" in making the pre-arrival reservations and activities, I will say that the service was very good once we were there. They even sent a snack tray to our room full of treats as an apology. We also were able to request a mini fridge for the room at no extra charge...great for juice boxes and snacks for our little ones! Only complaint was the pool we VERY COLD during our entire weekend stay...not a hit with our kids, which was one of the main things they wanted to do while in the hotel. Good room rate at the last minute and great location. We were able to walk easily to Mag Mile (for lights parade) and Navy Pier with no problem! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: WrldtrvlrThree
Reviews.Content: When I initially booked this hotel, the rate was $349/night but right before we left for Chicago, the rate dropped to $189/night. I think below $200/night is a fair price for this hotel. The location is fantastic, one block off of Michigan Avenue and walking distance from fabulous hotels. The noise level at night is pretty loud and walls are very thin. I could hear everything people were saying in the next room. Ordered room service one day and it was expensive, especially considering the food you can get right down the street. Overall good experience, however, I prefer the Renaissance on the river.

Reviews.Title: “Location..Location...Location”
Reviews.Author: wilmapais1
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at this gem of a hotel in the heart of downtown chicago. Large rooms perfect for family of 4 or 5 as we were able to do a rollaway too. Located 1/2blk from Michigan Ave...and right next to famous Garretts Popcorn...you have to buy some! We were able to walk to everything very safe,very clean,Starbucks on site and right down the street from the awesome Grand Luxe Cafe! Stop and talk to Hector and Neil at the concierge desk they hooked us up with all the best tours. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne L
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an ideal location, close to everything. Front desk staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Karen768
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on many occasions for a girls getaway at Christmas. We all love it and is a great location. Staff is extremely helpful and rooms are always neat and clean. We plan on being back in Dec. of this year. We are all looking forward to a comfortable stay. Thank you Marriot Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KYtraveler79
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at this Marriott in mid-October. This hotel definitely has an ideal location. It's central to everything you need to do. We loved that part. As for the hotel, it was fine. Nothing grand but nice. Very clean which is good but an average room. The lobby was tiny so there really wasn't any room to sit down and rest/talk. There are only 3 elevators up to the rooms so we waited a number of times for an elevator to become available. Overall, it was nice but I can't say that we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: doreen t
Reviews.Content: Upon our first moments in the hotel, the front desk agent was exhibiting how customer service at it's best should be. Lauren was so kind and helpful throughout our stay, we appreciated her so much. She made our stay memorable. We plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Erin P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Marriott Courtyard on the Magnificient Mile in Chicago many times and each time, the service exceeds what it was the time before! Everyone from the valet, bellhop and front desk were extremely friendly, accomodating and helpful! They took all of the stress off of me with parking and handling my luggage. This hotel's location was perfect and convenient to all of the shopping and restaurants we went to. We never even had to take a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price.”
Reviews.Author: malm1959
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband for a recent trip to chicago. His colleagues all stayed across the street in the other marriott which was more expensive. He said the courtyard was great and he was glad he saved 180 a night over the other hotel. He stayed on a high floor and was upgraded to a corner room with a good view. The only downside was that the breakfast bar was not open at 6:20 when he wanted to have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: alleycat96
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on Sept 17th 2011. Check in was easy, room was clean, internet worked fine. location was great. had everything we needed for the night. we didnt' spend alot of time in the room, but i would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Combination of Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: KR0703
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago recently for a print industry trade show. The event is at McCormick Place, and our company arranges for us to stay at either the McCormick Hyatt (nice but high priced and isolated), or the Chicago Hilton (nice but high priced, and no Marriott Points). This year, I checked into hotel alternative through the show website. That's where I found the Courtyard Chicago Downtown/Magnificent Mile. It's on Ontario, a block east of Michigan Avenue. It looks like a fairly new property; the lobby and rooms were clean and modern. There is a good range of services available, including a limited room service menu from the hotel restaurant. The location was perfect, within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, etc. The daily rate was about $50 cheaper than the alternatives, and I got my Marriot points. I would definitely recommend this to anyone traveling to the downtown Chicago are for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: GreatWall87
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is the best, as it is just 1 block from Michigan Ave. so most of the city landmarks (and the shopping areas as well) are within walking distance . The rooms and bathrooms are good - clean, well decorated and comfortable â€“ and the service is up the standard of a Courtyard Hotel. In the restaurants one can find all kinds of dining options and the Starbuck connection is good for a nice espresso. Noisy at time as all city hotels can be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Clean and Nice”
Reviews.Author: cjfcha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and had a great stay - very clean and nice hotel in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: INDrob83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past July and was extremely impressed. First of all, you cannot beat the parking price in downtown Chicago. I believe it was something like $36 a day; extremely inexpensive for this area! My two queen bed room included a refrigerator and a nice view of the skyline. The room was very clean and smelled nice. As usual, the beds were your usual, amazing Marriott beds. Michigan Avenue is a half block away, with a Garrett's Popcorn RIGHT NEXT DOOR, not to mention Dunkin Donuts (sorry Starbuck's, their coffee is better!). The staff was fantastic. This hotel is truly above and beyond a "select service". They have everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ShopperNYC
Reviews.Content: So you already know it's in a great location and you want to know if it's a dump, right? It's not. The lobby is nice, there's a Starbucks attached and a Dunkin Donuts across the street. The rooms are a nice size. (FYI There is no fridge or mini bar and as others noted, the bathroom was indeed split up, with sink outside and in view of the bedroom.) My only real complaints are that the towels were thin and scratchy and worse, the toilet paper was so thin and cheap that it literally disintegrates as soon as it touches your body (seriously, spring for some decent TP!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: missnee
Reviews.Content: The location is IDEAL for shopping on Michigan Avenue. You are one block away from everything and on the same block as Garrett's popcorn. The rooms were clean and cozy, although ours was a bit chilly. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friend reunion rescued”
Reviews.Author: profviolet
Reviews.Content: The Marriott brand is usually a good value for the money and, as I am determined to take advantage of my Rewards sometime during this millennium, I always look first for their hotels whenever I'm traveling. There is, however, one vexing idiosyncrasy about Marriotts of a certain vintage: the bathroom configuration. Many of their older hotels have separated fixtures, such as the shower/tub and toilet separate from the sink and vanity; the latter usually located outside of the closed door. I assume the idea was to allow for more than one guest to execute his/her bathroom functions at the same time. However, this arrangement is not always suitable for every combination of humans traveling together. Many travelers, women especially, prefer NOT to perform their ablutions in plain view of their traveling companion. This was the case when my friend and I arrived at the Courtyard Chicago Downtown and viewed our room featuring sink and vanity without the possibility of privacy. The hotel clerk at the reception desk was quick to offer a solution to our complaint. He suggested an "accessible" room with all toileting fixtures in the same room behind a single door. While we were loath to occupy such a room should there be a guest in true need of its handicap features, he assured us that there were other such rooms available in that case. With that dilemma resolved, my friend and I enjoyed a spectacular time in the Windy (and Cold!) City: dining, shopping, visiting museums, and catching up with one another after a long separation. The location is ideal, the lobby bar and restaurant are cozy and inviting and the staff are friendly and accommodating. An uncomfortable situation was averted by a thoughtful staff member, allowing for a splendid reunion between friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location... location... location”
Reviews.Author: Myinbox125
Reviews.Content: Hotel was typical of Courtyard hotels, though breakfast was not included. Location is KEY for this hotel as it is just 1 block east from Michigan Ave. Much of the key Michigan Ave. landmarks where within walking distance! All kinds of dining options from Capital Grille, near Tru, Gino's East Pizza, to 24hour opened Dunkin Donuts across the street. Access to Starbuck's on ground floor! Be ready to park next door for $28/per night. Make sure to see front desk for the discount parking ticket. PROS: (1) location, (2) clean & updated acommodations CONS: (1) Parking is tight & cost $28 per night. "Tight" as in it was a corkscrew type structure where an SUV would have to drive slowly/carefully from floor to floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Barlin63
Reviews.Content: This is actually a very good hotel. The rooms are nice, the restaurant is good and staff is very friendly. It shows that the hotel is recently renovated although the room doors to the hall way are not very good isolated. Everything that happens on the corridor will be witnessed in the rooms. In a previous review there were some complaints about the internet but that seems to be resolved completely. In room we had perfect wifi connections with 2 laptops an iPad and an iPhone. Congrats on that! Although you can call for room service to clean you room at a certain time it is always a surprise whether they had cleaned the room or not. Very annoying when you return to the hotel after a day trip and the room is still not cleaned! This should be an easy fix and should be fixed right away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirl2020
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location! The rooms are great as is the service. This will sound stupid, but the hotel parking garage is intimidating. I really like Marriott family hotels more so than others. They are clean, well decorated and comfortable. What I hate is that wireless is not free.... Stay here for the location, service and comfy rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: catsforkids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend and enjoyed the location of this hotel immensely. For the money, it just cannot be beat. The rooms are quite spacious and the bed very comfortable. Our room was on the 22nd floor so street noise was not a problem. We actually opened the window (all 5 inches it would go up) in the morning to hear the city waking up. The location is great...a block to Michigan Avenue and two blocks to Rush Street with a plethora of great eating establishments. A 15 minute (or less) walk takes you to Navy Pier and the lakefront.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Fantastic Location, Great for Reunions”
Reviews.Author: GRLPWR-4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for a family reunion. The staff was very flexible, helpful, and friendly. Hotel rooms were clean, and the lobby was surprising large. We received an excellent group price for our reunion. In fact, we checked about 20 hotels and this location's pricing was far more competitive than other locations. WHAT'S GOOD: First, it is an excellent location. Starbucks is located in the lobby (expensive for continental breakfast). Corner Bakery is not too far away; shopping on Mag Mile, Wendella Boat tours, and even Navy Pier are within walking distance. Great restaurants, like Gino's East or Ed Debevics, are a short cab ride away. The hotel was clean and comfortable enough. There is an indoor pool, a workout center, a spacious enough lobby, wifi, and a community laundry room with a microwave. The staff was great. We had many requests where they really needed to go beyond the simple "hello" or giving directions in order to accommodate the many needs we had with family members. They rose to the challenge and did well. WHAT'S OK: The pool isn't as large as it appears on the website. Not a big deal, at all...rather it's just a little deceiving. It is a saline pool, so the water seemed to bother the kids' eyes more than a regular chlorinated pool (several kids were bothered by this). The King bedrooms are modest in size, not spacious. This is fine for two adults but for a family of 5 trying to stay together in the same room, it is a tighter squeeze than what we like. I have heard of two complaints from family members about loud guests late at night. Perhaps the reasonable price brings a younger, rowdier crowd that likes to burn the midnight oil. Overall, we were extremely pleased with this hotel. They worked with us to meet all of our families' needs. The helpful staff really added to the positive energy our family had with being together and we all felt it was a wonderful experience. Our family is still talking about the great time we had being together and staying downtown. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location - great service”
Reviews.Author: our2sense
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (3 younger children) spent two nights here. We looked at all the Marriott properties and chose it based on its location, size, and reviews posted on Trip Advisor by others. It was great. One block off Michigan Ave. Four blocks from river. Three or Four blocks from Lake Shore walkway. You can walk to the Hancock Building. And about 8 blocks to Navy Pier. Nearby diners, Panera, Chipotle. Trader Joe's was 3 blocks away. There is a small fridge and microwave in the room which was SO nice. Parking was easy in affiliated garage and elevator connected it. Pleasant lobby. Staff was courteous, helpful and friendly. We asked for extra towels and pillows. They didn't come right away but about 20 minutes later, someone called to follow-up on them. Unexpected quality of service. We were disappointed that we requested early check-in and didn't get it. We were there about 11AM and at 2PM, they still didn't have a room. But, right at check-in time which is 3PM, they did call us on our cell to let us our room was ready. We were able to park our car and start our visit though and because of its central location, it was easy for us to take in a little Chicago and come back. Small pool in hotel (3 to 4.5 feet). My daughters said the water wasn't clear though, even with their goggles on. Nice workout room overlooking street but we didn't use it. Also, like the follow-up email by the GM to make sure our visit was outstanding. Overall, I'd say we were very pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: plaug
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the location of the hotel. So convenient to walk to everything. Affordable, Starbucks in lobby, extremely comfortable beds and nice bar next door. Very clean, too. Easy to walk to "El" train stop with luggage to get to and from airport. Great Marriott service and friendliness. We had a room across from the elevator and it was very quiet the 3 nights we were there, which usually isn't the case with a room in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Experience”
Reviews.Author: bwarn73
Reviews.Content: Business trip here was good experience. Food in restaurant is great and the service both for hotel and restaurant was wonderful. Would do again definitely. Location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Grade A+ only 1 block off the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: KFouts_619
Reviews.Content: Never knew this hotel was here until I picked up client who stayed there last year - can safely say that they are added to my list of properties to check any time I want to stay in the city! Great location only 1 block off Michigan Avenue. Every staff member I encountered was friendly, professional, and made me feel like a VIP, and the size of the room and quality of furnishings, etc., far exceeded my expectations. Mattress surprisingly firm for a downtown hotel, but that works for me! (p.s.: Cottonelle toilet tissue?! NICE!) 10th floor pool is a little small, but was a great place to relax and splash in the water after several hours of walking in the heat - adjacent workout room has better-than-average equipment as well. Did not try the restaurant, but there's a convenience store within 1 block, and a Dominick's grocery store within 3 blocks. If you're resourceful and have a small cooler, you can do very well.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel! Great location & price, awesome room!”
Reviews.Author: stephcarlson
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It is in a fantastic location - next to Garrett's Popcorn, right off Michigan Avenue, complete with a Starbucks in the lobby! The hotel is clean and quiet and the room was plenty large to accommodate our family of 5. And the price was great for a downtown hotel. We were extremely impressed and would definitely stay here again. The parking was a pretty great deal too, compared to other downtown hotel experiences we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Katmandu72
Reviews.Content: Rooms are on the small side but still very nice- everything you need. The location is wonderful. We walked everywhere from here! We are also runners and it is very close and accessible to the Lakefront Trail. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: wb22860
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and service at this hotel. Will stay here again and again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location -- would come again”
Reviews.Author: SKHUDBS
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and had a great time. Hotel has parking, a pool, Starbucks, internet, and anything else you want within walking distance. Ice cream across the street, great restaurants on every block! Had a few minor issues but I have to say, the staff and GM stepped up and took care of everything. If you're looking for an affordable hotel in a great location this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok rooms.”
Reviews.Author: 123lori
Reviews.Content: First of all the service was wonderful! We stayed on the 16th floor and right after checking in we noticed our toilet would leak and spray water all over. I called and they sent someone up to fix it right away. They even made a follow-up call to our room to make sure it was fixed. The room was clean and smelled good. There was a big stain on the carpet though. I called for extra towels and they sent them up immediately. The staff was very friendly! The beds were the worst. They were very hard and squeaked when you moved on them. The wireless in the room didn't work properly. I could log on and get to some websites like Weather.com and Usa today but it wouldn't let me search Safari or Facebook. I gave up after the first couple of tries. I took my 7 year old daughter to the pool to swim and there was way too much chlorine in it. My daughter couldn't stop spitting because the taste was so bad and it burned her eyes. The pool size is small, about the size of a backyard pool. The depth ranges from 3 ft. to 4 ft. 6 inch. or so. It's the perfect size for young children. It did get quite crowded at times with older kids playing catch. I think I counted 12 at one time. The water was cool, not very warm for an indoor pool. And there were 4 lounge chairs to sit on but they were all falling apart. There was a lot of standing water between the door and the pool. Very unsafe. And I noticed there were 5 hotel rooms that had their windows opening into the pool area on the 10th floor. A little weird for me. The location was great! We walked to the Rainforest cafe, The American Girl store, Garretts popcorn next store, Dunkin Donuts around the corner, etc. This hotel must be near a hospital because we did hear sirens often. Parking garage was tight but very convenient for guests and affordable--$28/day. Overall, this was a very basic hotel. You are definitely paying for the location which was close to a lot. I would stay here again if the beds were more comfortable and the pool was taken care of properly (a pool is a must with kids).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to mix a bit of pleasure with the business”
Reviews.Author: YULwoman
Reviews.Content: was here 4 days for work conference held in the hotel. Friendly staff, good food, clean spacious rooms, a little noisy though, with lots of sirens - I think there's a hospital 2 blocks over. Walking distance to Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, river, Millenium Park and the Cloud Gate. Lots of great restaurants nearby to choose from. So managed to squeeze in a mini vacation between the meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, convenient hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Jandbmeyers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when doing business at an office on the Magnificent Mile. The hotel was very functional...free wifi was a plus...and the adjoining Starbucks was very convenient. I ordered room service one evening which took a very long time to arrive, but the next morning I had a note of apology under my door with a gift certificate for a free Starbucks coffee. The room service food, though, was very good. I went out for a run one afternoon and found it easy to run down to Millenium Park and back in about 20 minutes. The last time I was doing business in this location, I stayed at the W Hotel near the lake. It is obviously difficult to compare the two hotels, but I would stay at the Courtyard again next time just for its basic good service, convenience, and functionality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ecco815
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Courtyard Downtown for 3 nights in July. The hotel is clean, comfortable, quiet, and well-priced for where it is. It's right next to the Magnificent Mile and we had no problems walking to all the major downtown Chicago sights. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In my life (51 years) the 2nd worst hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: bubba073
Reviews.Content: You would think a hotel would have enough parking for it's guests sometime between 4:00 pm and 10:00 pm but not here. I had to find parking in downtown Chicago on a Saturday night at 10.00. Everything was full except the Water tower ramp 8 blocks away. Also the room phone did not work (can't call for repairs or wake up calls or receive them). DON'T use the pool it is dirty, filthy and filled with algae and hair. Staff does not seem to care. Room carpet was stained with black footprints. Noisy air conditioner, toilet, and sirens. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Sleep Experience”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: In a lot of ways, this hotel was fine, but the average rating is a result of the hotel falling short at the most basic function of a hotel -- providing a good sleep experience. The horrible sleep experience we had was driven by two problems: (1) the MOST uncomfortable, cheap mattress I've encountered at a hotel in a LONG time (and I stay in hotels 200+ nights a year), and (2) cheap, threadbare linens. Honestly, I could not believe the mattress. It was a brick with NO give and was of the quality you'd expect in an old Motel 6. It actually squeaked when you sat on it or moved in the night -- I haven't had a hotel bed squeak and creak in years. I felt like I was at a Travelodge. The linens did not help. Although they were the standard Courtyard bedding (disclosure: I think the Courtyard bedding is an awful bedding package, baseline), it was threadbare and in serious need of replacement. The pillows were similarly cheap -- small, synthetic-feeling, no support, etc. Although the linens appeared to be clean, when a pillowcase slipped off a pillow, we noticed the pillow itself was covered in yellow stains. Towels in the bathroom were similarly thin and threadbare. So, overall, the sleep experience was cheap and terrible. The rest of the hotel was decent. The room was large. It was very much the standard Courtyard room; it had the newer decor with the patterned wallpaper behind the beds. Very corporate-feeling, but clean and perfectly functional. The lobby was small -- pretty much the check-in desk, a couple of chairs, and the elevators -- but, again, perfectly functional. Service was good; check-in was speedy and welcoming, check-out was easy. Overall, however, the poor sleep experience made for an unenjoyable stay. When I'm back in Chicago, I won't be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: robsden
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in downtown Chicago. The price is right, the rooms are reasonably big and clean in the Marriott style. Definitely will go back when travelling to Chicago. I had a bad experience with another hotel so this hotel was quite nice for a change of style.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Flalga0604
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel if you desire a good night's sleep after a long day on the Magnificent Mile! Sirens blare all hours of the night penetrating the room at a high decibel level making sleeping very difficult. Also, rooms near the elevator during conventions can further complicate getting a good night's sleep. Pros Location Large rooms Friendly bellman Cons NOISY Indoor pool area needs attention Crowded small lobby & check in area No special attention if you are a Honored Guest Member (none of my room request honored despite making reservation several weeks in advance via Marriott's website)

Reviews.Title: “Great for shopping, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Lizaboo78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few days ago when we visited Navy Pier and the Shedd Aquarium. The hotel is located just off Michigan Ave., in a very good location for both shopping on the Mile and we found the walk to Navy Pier was easy as well. We stayed in a king room, with a pull-out sofa. The room was a very good size, and nicely decorated and clean. After a long day of shopping, we came back to the hotel to swim for awhile. The pool area is on the 10th floor, and I have to admit I found it disappointing. The room was horribly hot, and did not look very clean. The tiles looked dirty and the the caulking around the lower part of the windows looked moldy and disgusting. There is a parking garage attached to the hotel, and at $28, it's not a bad deal at all. There's also valet parking available. The hotel staff are friendly, and very informative about local shopping and tours. The construction on the facade of the building was loud, but the hotel was working hard to make it as low-key as possible. I think on the whole this was a nice hotel, and if we weren't looking for a pool we would stay here again. I would add to the hotel that things like the disgusting pool area, and even little things like the very wrinkled daily information sheet posted in the elevator make what could be a great hotel into one where little signs of neglect are clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Tprat55
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old daughter, and I stayed for an weekday evening downtown to go to the zoo and aquarium. This hotel was in a great location to get to all these locations. The staff was very welcoming and helpfull. We'll definiately be back for shopping on Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Pullman1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Courtyard four times in the last year, sometimes for business and sometimes for pleasure. My first trip was outstanding: great room, fabulous view, terrific staff. It's been downhill since then. I returned this time only because it was part of a wedding package, and because I am a sucker for Marriott points. But I definitely won't be back. The good news is that the hotel has a great location one block off the Magnificent Mile, in the heart of the neighborhood called Streeterville. You can walk to all sorts of restaurants, shops, and other attractions. The corner rooms, with floor-to-ceiling windows on two sides, are a little cramped and have a weird shape but are bright, airy, and have stunning views. That's where I would always choose to stay. Many of the other rooms have dingy views. On this trip, the windows were unbelievably dirty. On both of my most recent visits, the hotel has been overcrowded and didn't handle the crowds well. You had to fight your way through the lobby at times, and there were long, long waits both at the front desk and for elevators, especially on the way down. Many people who wanted to go down were getting in the elevator on the way up, knowing that it was likely to be full by the time it came back to them. We waited over 5 minutes while trying to check out. There are some very welcoming staff, especially some of the doormen and waitresses. But on this trip, the front desk was totally on auto-pilot. The words would come out with a smile, but there was no corresponding action. I had a billing error, for example. "We'll look into that for you and get right back to you," the desk clerk said. Never heard from him again, and the error is still there as I write this review. My sense is that like some of the other up-scale Courtyards, this hotel is coasting on its location and its once-new, but now aging, physical plant. It has no personality, no style, and it's no fun at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bbarajas2487
Reviews.Content: Located one block off Michigan Avenue right in the middle of prime shopping and restaurants. Room service prices are very, very reasonable, I was shocked and very pleased, the food was great! I had a burger, fries, soup and a soft drink for $20.00. Room was perfect, nice size and very clean. The staff is very courteous and quick to help, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: ohmigod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend trade show in Chicago. Rooms excellent size and slightly upgraded on usual Courtyard style. Always find this chain good for the business traveller but it would be agood choice for the tourist too as very central. Nice classy bar for business meetings but did not eat there as many good restaurants all around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good walking distance to shopping.”
Reviews.Author: firebird350
Reviews.Content: We are local to Chicago but wanted to spend the weekend as "tourists". We were greeted promptly and able to check right into our room (11am) that was a nice surprise. The room was good however, since we were traveling with my 4 year old I wanted to bring juice and snacks for him so we did not have to buy everything downtown. I checked the hotel fact sheet on line in the General Room Amenities and it says that the rooms had a mini fridge and in fact it did not, I tried to keep our stuff cold in our sink with ice. The only real problem was everytime our neighbor would close the door to their room our door shook and sounded like someone was trying to get onto our room. This happened quite a bit throughout the night and kept waking us up. Since we were traveling with a child we of course had to check out the pool. It was a nice pool except the pool area was about 100 degrees and impossible to sit and relax as it was so hot. I don't know if that is done on purpose. Overall, a nice hotel. Good location, the doormen were the best and the most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Happy 10th Anniversary in Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen1379
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this city, especially this hotel. Neil, our Concerierge at the hotel was outstanding. He made a couple from Bradford, Ontario Canada feel like the #1 couple in Chicago on our 10th anniversary. Thank you. Great location, great staff, great experience. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in many ways, but not very soundproof :(”
Reviews.Author: Lungfruit
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. There are so many positives about it. But in the end I don't think I'd stay here again because my room (and therefore I assume all rooms) lack adequate sound proofing from outside noise. I stayed here for a nearby conference and was pleasantly surprised about how this hotel seemed more "upscale" than what I imagined a Courtyard would be. It's location and price really can't be beat. I've stayed at many hotels in downtown Chicago and this is the best value for it's location. The noise from the street at night was so loud that even with ear plugs I was awakened many times and slept very little. They have a small fitness center but it has everything you need. Pros: -Great location for price -Starbucks in lobby -Friendly, attentive staff -Clean, updated rooms Cons: - Street noise was intrusive to the point of ruining sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: suzee012
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay! The hotel was clean; in fact, the bathtub was sparkling clean, which you don't always find. The staff was very friendly, and the hotel was comfortable. I wish there had been a restaurant or bar in the hotel. There was a Starbucks, which was nice, but something else would have been nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: rooney1842
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this location while attending a national conference. From our very first experience upon entering, we were greeted by a friendly and welcoming staff. We would return from out conference location a couple of times throughout the day and upon every return we walked in to a greeting of "Welcome back" or something like that. All of our questions about where to dine or directions to some location were explained thoroughly. The staff was courteous and willing to create a satisfactory experience for us. I truly have never encountered such a friendly staff. The management at this property deserves great credit for their customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a vip all the time”
Reviews.Author: tpup
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant of a courtyard buy service top to bottom was amazing. Neil and the asian bell captains were amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel committed to my comfort”
Reviews.Author: dentaldoc91
Reviews.Content: Renting three rooms for myself and my dental team, the entire organization seemed to appreciate us as guests and worked their butts off to make sure we were happy. From Justin at the front desk who researched and typed up a list of gluten free restaurants to Victor who fixed our heat, everyone did that little extra that encouraged me to tell you to stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: LindaC47
Reviews.Content: At a recent stay in Chicago for our anniversary, we were treated like royalty. All the staff members went out of their way to help us, answer questions quickly, even gave us chocolate covered strawberries. We'll look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service perfection”
Reviews.Author: Fishnette
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an outstanding staff that always goes the extra mile for their guests. I had made my own arrangements to get to the airport in the morning, but the bellman saved the day for me by calling to find out that the shuttle had forgotten me and then got me a reliable cab to the airport. I would definitely stay here again if I'm every in this area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cgarver3
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and, to our surprise, we were able to get into our room right away (11am). The room was comfortable and well-appointed. We were very happy with the accommodations and the desk staff. They were awesome! Looking forward to going back to Chicago and this will be my first choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, great food---what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: elaine760
Reviews.Content: The location and service at this hotel couldn't have been better. We stayed here while a family member had surgery at a nearby hospital and we just happened to be there during Chicago's big snow storm. The hotel staff helped to make these two adversities more bearable! Lisa, the other staff members at the front desk, Neil the doorman, and housekeeping helped to equip us with what we needed. The restaurant food was great---both in the restaurant itself and when we ordered room service. We highly recommend this hotel and we plan to return when everyone is healthy.

Reviews.Title: “Super experience”
Reviews.Author: bnklwyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early February 2011 (Sun to Thurs). Supposed to check out Weds, but blizzard hit. Staff marvelous the entire time, adding an extra day no problem and rate was the same for the additional day. Staff found a way to be there on the 3rd largest snowstorm in Chicago history. Good room (better than we had in the Marriott on Michigan Avenue last summer--which cost $150 or so more per night.) Only not perfect thing was restaurant (which may not be part of the hotel officially but you can enter from the hotel) where it was closed on Sunday night--not necessarily a problem in Downtown Chicago) but where service was mediocre. Overall though a great hotel experience, if you are not looking for the frills (e.g., hopping lobby, stores, bar, etc.), which we felt we didn't need in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend stay for Bears/Patriots game”
Reviews.Author: rumbeam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well done -- you pretty much know what you are going to get with Courtyards by Marriott. Almost no frills, though they do have a fireplace in the lobby you can hang by if you get lucky enough to grab one of the seats. Rooms were clean and service was good. The pool is small and not great. The fitness room is decent. There are good options nearby for food -- Dunkin Donuts is right across the street if you want to sneak out of your room in the a.m. and grab coffee real quick in your pajamas and coat (I did). There is a Corner Bakery a few blocks down for breakfast. The doormen were great -- always found us cabs when in short supply -- they have their act together. Attached parking is not cheap but for us was worth the convenience....we parked after driving in and then took short cab rides as needed. I have no qualms recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: sweetie_djb
Reviews.Content: We were 2 groups of 4 people, stayed 2 nights in 2 rooms. Very cheerfully greeted and welcomed, check in was quick, rooms were clean, beds very comfortable. Excellent location, walking distance to shopping. Justin C. went out of his way to assist us with a situation (not associated with the Hotel); Nicole H. assisted in directions, etc. very pleasantly pleased with the choice of hotel. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excellence - Warm Hospitality in the City”
Reviews.Author: DJJOS
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard leaves you with more of a feeling of a B&B than a hotel. From the moment you arrive everyone that works there is friendly, helpful and just downright welcoming! The lobby is bustling, but with the warmth of the fireplace and the delicious aroma of the freshly baked cookies you get the feel of a B&B. In a big city like Chicago and being located on such a busy corner that's quite an accomplishment. The staff is the BEST, HANDS DOWN that I have ever encountered. I've stayed in some highly rated B&B's and not received the welcoming treatment that I experienced at the Courtyard Marriott. Much to my delight, every morning and afternoon they have delicious homemade cookies and cider/hot chocolate in the lobby. On my first morning there as I was approaching the heavenly display of cookies one of the staff members came over and insisted on serving me..............NICE TOUCH. THE BEDS ARE SO COMFY, you want to take them home with you. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, right next door to Garrett's popcorn...............it truly does not get better than that (also, maybe 1/2 a block from Michigan Avenue)! I was on the elevator one day full of people and a staff member happened to be on and he kept asking all of us if we needed any help with our packages and was there anything the hotel could do to make our stay more enjoyable. The main thing that really caught my eyes and ears was the staff all seemed quite genuine in their efforts to make the hotel a great, memorable experience and, in my opinion, they went above and beyond any hotel experience I have ever had. I would recommend this hotel to the most discriminating traveler I know and feel assured that they would come away with the same feeling. KUDOS to the Courtyard!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: goldengirl217
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing rate at this hotel which made it a wonderful trip. I paid only $149 a night for a corner room with great views of downtown Chicago. I booked almost a year in advance so it worked out really well, because leading up to our trip, these rooms were booking for $349 a night! We had an awesome room, not the biggest room, but very nice with windows all around the room. The staff was great at the hotel. My fiance actually proposed to me that weekend and had to have the ring shipped directly to the hotel and they did a great job of tracking it and getting it to him without ruining the surprise for me. The hotel is in an awesome location. I didn't appreciate this when I booked as I had never been to Chicago before. You are one short block from the heart of the Magnificent Mile. It is about 4 blocks to the subway which is a little walk, but taxis are quite cheap in Chicago and you can always get one outside of the hotel. My only complaint was that I could never get the hotel WiFi to work on my Ipod touch. I generally don't have any problems and I could see the signal but it wouldn't let me stay connected to it. I would highly recommend this hotel. I'm not sure it is worth $349 a night but it is definitely worth $200 a night. The location and the rooms are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: travelady042
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 1 block from the Magnificent Mile. The surrounding area is interesting and walkable. The hotel doesn't have a huge, fancy lobby, but it the room was large, comfortable, well decorated and very clean. It looked recently renovated. The bellman was super friendly and front desk staff were friendly as well. We self-parked in the somewhat claustrophobic garage next door. The garage staff was also super-friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kdpbball
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chicago. The staff, to a person, was most friendly & courteous. Everyone went out of their way to answer questions, give directions, etc. Stephanie of Guest Services helped us with tour reservations & recommended local restaurants for Chicago cuisine, like deep-dish pizza & hot dogs!! We had a room on the 15th floor & it was very quiet. Everything we wanted to see was easily accessible via the EL, bus or on foot. I would definitely stay here again if the opportunity arose. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BigSausage
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for an over nighter and were pleasantly surprised by thr friendliness of the staff and especially the bell personal. The room itself was large, clean and perhaps one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in, if I could I would have carried it out with me upon departing. Would stay again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “great location..”
Reviews.Author: Buquing
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago a couple of times a year and have stayed in a dozen of hotels (from 3-5 stars) around Michigan Ave...by far this one has to be the one that suits me best...rooms are clean enough though bathrooms need renovation..staff are nice and have let me check-in earlier when rooms are available...however rates do vary depending on your travel dates...most of the times I get a good rate (pay 2 get 1 night free) but there are times when the rate would be high enough that it turns out even cheaper to stay at the Westin or Marriott (full service)..still, this is my hotel of choice whenever I'm in Chi-town..

Reviews.Title: “You can count on Marriott for quality...superb staff and awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: mamapuetzy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a magical weekend for my daughter's bachelorette party. The Marriott was awesome! We can't say enough about the helpful and friendly staff. You can always count on the quality and value you get from Marriott. We are starting a fan club for Andrew, front desk, Sith, doorman, and Efrain, bellman. The concierge helped us with wonderful coupons for "Howl at the Moon". Just one block from Michigan Avenue, the location is fantastic, close to the Grand Lux restaurant and Garrett's popcorn, and SHOPPING! The hotel is a gem, we'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, friendly staff, center location to everything!”
Reviews.Author: sh2699
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean, worked well for our family. Doorman very helpful in loading and unloading. My son loved the fish on front desk. Comfortable beds & linens, Clean bath!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Pontyack
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a weekend and I loved the place. The staff was very friendly and the room was very comfortable. Our room was slightly different than the pictures that were posted on the hotel's site, but the beds were amazingly comfortable. The room was very quiet and the elevators very fast. The only thing I thought this hotel was missing was a hot tub. After a long weekend of walking, it would have been a plus to have one.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: jasonhe
Reviews.Content: Lackluster lobby gives way to spacious, spotless, glamorous rooms rivaling those of much pricier hotels. Street noise can creep through to even the highest floors â€” but the upside is a convenient central location, a quick walk from Michigan Avenue shopping and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Need ears plugs at this place !”
Reviews.Author: Markhan
Reviews.Content: Ok so great location, large clean rooms and friendly staff but the noise at this place is unbelievable. As mentioned by another reviewer the ambulance noise is constant and we were on the 24th floor so it must be really bad on lower floors, also the walls are paper thin so you can hear people next door using their bathroom !!!. Another gripe is that for $750 for 3 nights I expect a decent a/c unit and a flat screen tv. The a/c only just managed to keep the room cool enough to sleep if we left it on full all day & night and the TV was ancient with a terrible picture. One more thing that we didn't like is that if you use the attached car park you have to come down from your parking floor in a lift then drag your cases through the lobby area and then into the hotel lifts. It took us 3 journeys to get our stuff from the car park to the room. So all in all not a place we would ever use again mainly due to noise issues and the poor a/c and TV.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: IULynn
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Magnificent Mile is a nice hotel in a great location one block off of Michigan. The only negative was the constant ambulance noise. The hotel is 2 blocks from Northwestern Hospital. Rooms were a good size for downtown Chicago. Fitness center was large with many cardio machines and weights. Pool was small but perfect for my children. Self Parking is $28 in attached garage for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: DaphneBernstein
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago on business frequently and have stayed at several Marriott properties in the area. I really like the Blackstone, but decided to stay at the Courtyard for this stay for one reason - I was very impressed that the marketing director took the time to comment on each TripAdvisor review. Once I got to the hotel, I found the service to be exceptional in all areas. I brought my ten year-old daughter with me and we had a very nice time. There were only two things that could have gone better: (1) Reservations gave me the wrong information about parking prices and I wish that I had paid for the package that had parking included, and (2) Marriott doesn't seem to give platinum members quite the same level of service that they once did. Still, the service was very good. The location was perfect, with shopping and food within walking distance. We were there to go to the American Girl store and it would have been nice if this hotel had the American Girl package to select. My daughter would have really liked that! The Capital Grill is right across the street, and there are many other places within a few blocks. Parking was convenient and there was no real reason for us to valet. The lounge was very cool in the evening. The fitness area had new fitness equipment and everything you needed. The pool was a fair size, but my daughter said it was way too cold! Brrrr! Our room was clean, updated, and comfortable. Good water pressure in the shower. Not sure I am quite diggin' Courtyard's new furniture - I like the look, but the quality is questionable. Still, I'll take this updated look over the old Courtyards any day! If you are looking for a great downtown hotel at a good price, this one is unique with exceptional service, good location, and has everything you need. There is even a Starbucks on the main level. I would, and will, stay here again. Thanks Courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Very Clean location perfect”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in downtown Chicago, full service Marriott and Conrad to name a few. This hotel for me was as good or better! Your night audit was great! Very clean rooms and the lobby was spotless. Front desk was quick and nice. Such an enjoyable stay, I can't wait to come back! The hotel is located in the heart of downtown Chicago. Chicago is the best big town in America safe, clean, and fun. Thanks for a great stay, I look forward to coming back soon. Anyone reading this, book your room and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: dhatton3000
Reviews.Content: I have had many trips down to this hotel and I wouldn't stay anwhere else! It is a beautiul, clean property like all courtyard mariotts; the staff are amazing. From the second we arrived to the second we depart on all stays, the staff have been outstandingly friendly It is the perfect hotel in the perfect location; it is a 5 minute walk from the hancock building, a short walk to navy pier and the tribune tower. It couldn't be in a more perfect place. The front office manager Martin is (like me) from Manchester,UK and he went above and beyond for all his guests and staff. The hotel restaurant is beautiul, but I also recommend the little italian retaurant aross the road. On site is a great restaurant, starbucks, shop, fitness centre, car park and swimming pool. I love Chicago, its one of my favorite cities in the world,and wouldnt choose anywhere else to stay but the CY Marriott Mag Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeyejohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed downtown at the Courtyard Magnificent Mile and had a wonderful time. The ease of getting around was great. The staff was extremely helpful with plans for the area, how to get around, where to go, reservations for dinner, etc. We had a FANTASTIC time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION-GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Hygienist83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott on Michigan Ave last summer. The rooms at the Courtyard are much more roomier and seem newer, bathroom much bigger too.. The location is great!!The staff was always friendly. We arrived early, a room we requested was not available-the manager upgraded our room. We always had to walk by Garret's popcorn to get back to the hotel-we saw when the line was the shortest and it always smelled so good!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It!”
Reviews.Author: Midwestfreqtrav
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough good things about this hotel. Arrived Saturday, March 13 at noon and were allowed to check in early with no issue, the only delay was the front desk person spent a few extra minutes trying to match a room to my request online (high floor, corner). The various doormen I encountered were always helpful with directions, getting a cab, or just holding the door open. Didn't use the pool or gym, but both looked nice. Room was very clean and quite, beds comfy. Location was outstanding, 1/2 a block to Michigan Avenue, a Dunkin Donuts across the street, and a Trader's Joe's right across Michigan Ave. There are about 5 Starbuck's, Subway's, and Walgreens withing walking distance, as well as the bus stop to the museums. All the tourist eateries are within easy walking distance (Gino's East, Rainforest Cafe, Ed Devevics). Don't miss Carson's for Ribs, maybe the best Ribs and Pork Chops I've ever had. Also a short cab ride from Second City. Really, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very nice, with a great location for downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jcs3Ct
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, with a great location for downtown Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Travellllllller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at beginning of Feb. Very, very comforatable beds, very large room, pleasant front-desk staff, good location, good breakfast included. Would definitely stay here again. (Had booked Millenium Knickerbocker for 2 nights at the end of my trip - it was not half as nice, although twice the price and didn't include breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Very Dry Heat”
Reviews.Author: johnschmitt1964
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently been remodeled, the rooms look great and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was gracious and knowleglable. Our room located on the 20th floor still had the smell of new carpet. The pool was small but enjoyable when not full of splashing childern. The only issues that I had were with the HVAC system in the room. There first night it would cycle warm then cool. This was reported to the front desk and while we were out on Saturday it was fixed. When we returned Saturday evening the room was comfortably warm. however it was a very dry heat. I woke up twice during the night with my mouth and nose dried out. How ever over all it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, safe part of the City”
Reviews.Author: hopster412
Reviews.Content: I'm always leery about staying at hotels I haven't stayed at before, but when we got to the hotel, we were VERY pleased with the location, the cleanliness, and up-scale feeling of the hotel. We got a room for $99 on New Year's Eve and thought that was a very affordable rate in Chicago. I was very pleased with the room, the restaurant/bar and the employees were very nice and professional. I will DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Big City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjkToronto
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent group rate as part of a road trip supporting an MLS team. If you can get a deal like this it was a real bargain for such a central location. Moderate walking distance to Navy Pier, close to the Lego Store, and the subway. Rooms were pretty much identical to any other Marriott property I have been in. Clean, nice step up from cheaper hotels but not always worth the price depending on what rate you are getting. View from the room was a city view, nothing spectacular but neat. Hotel felt very big based on the lobby bar area and the # of elevators. Check out was very busy on a Sunday morning - we used the TV checkout option in our rooms but had to wait for our friends. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “city hotels”
Reviews.Author: carriglio
Reviews.Content: Centrally located (50mt from Magnificent Mile) it's a good hotel with confortable rooms. Ask for high flow rooms . Downstairs , close to the hall, a Starbucks where you can have real espresso

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: RLB72
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends recently enjoyed a weekend getaway in Chicago. We would highly recommend the Courtyard. The staff was absolutely friendly and very helpful. The location to Michigan Avenue was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great rate and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: bigbluefan
