Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay in Chicago.The Courtyard Marriott was an excellent choice for our annual shopping trip.The location is just a short block off Michigan Ave.Very close to Corner Bakery,Dunkin Donut and Garrett Popcorn.All our requests(early check-in,higher floor,extra pillows)were met and a rate of 79.00pr night made it all good.Very friendly check-in and doorman and a extra clean room made our stay enjoyable and entirely to short.We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishPeteKnows
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, about 1/4 of a block from Michigan avenue. Once on Michigan there are a plethora of restaurants and bars to choose from. I'll break my review down to a few aspects of the hotel Check In: Not a pleasant experience. There were 3 big groups checking in the same time as us and 1 person manning the check in counter. After 15 minutes they eventually pulled someone else over. Finally after nearly 30 minutes they gave us our key. They conveniently forgot about the $25 gift card we selected on their website. Forget about that. Its not a gift card. Its a promise to pay reabate that you must mail in when you return home. Thanks! Room: We were put on the top floor orignally in a terrible room with no view. We called down to the front desk to see if we could be switched. After 20 rings, and no answer, I headed downstairs. I asked for a corner room, as I requested on the internet. They finally gave use one, saying it only had a queen beed. I didnt care about that. This room was awesome with an extra long window facing the lake (partially obstructed by taller buildings). New LG LCD tv and another window facing North (John Hancock partially visable). Pool: Forget about it. Its a glorified hot tub, except the water is freezing. If your looking for a nice relaxing swim - dont stay here. Staff: Most of the staff were helpful, nothing execptional though. I had a run in with the restaurant bartender the Saturday night they were there. He was running his mouth and shooting down all of his customers opinions on the upcoming NFL season. I blurted out "your an idiot" and he totally freaked out. Took my drink from me, told me I'm cutoff , and asked me to leave the bar. Needless to say this really irritated my wife and I and we complained the next day to the barley 30 year old manager. He was useless and didnt offer us anything in compensation. Restaurant - Good for drinks, didnt try the food, avoid sitting at the bar when there is a tall skinny black haired kid with long sideburns. Overall - I would definetly check out the proper Marriott , Hilton, or Renaissance next time I stay downtown Chicago. This was cheaper yes, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abbywOuterBanksNC
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything! Starbucks for mornings and a great bar and restaurant for evenings. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I will definitely stay here when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, superior customer service”
Reviews.Author: nickbegley
Reviews.Content: I had the fortune to spend the weekend in Chicago and chose to stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Chicago Downtown / Magnificent Mile. It's important to note that we were visiting the Second City for the 2009 Bank of America Chicago Marathon, so the hotel was full and the city was packed with runners and spectators. My wife and I experienced tremendous customer service during the length of our stay at the hotel. The check-in process was seamless and the friendliness of the staff was evident in our very first interactions. The great service continued every step of the way during our stay -- from the front desk to the bellhop to the housekeepers. Everyone we interacted with was happy to help and treated us very well. The location was incredible as well. We were in walking distance to major shopping on the Magnificent Mile (1/2 block from the entrance to the hotel) and hundreds of fine restaurants. We were also very close to public transportation and used it to access the different neighborhoods that make Chicago such a great weekend destination. The only complaint I have in terms of amenities would be the Starbucks located within the hotel. It was a very small location and was always jam packed. We attempted to grab coffee on two separate occasions, only to be 'turned away' from the long line. Instead, we opted to get our caffeine fix at the Dunkin' Donuts located 100 yards from the hotel. On a more positive note, the free wireless internet was fast and easy to access (a huge perk in our book!). The room we stayed in was very large and included a king size bed and full sofa. It was very clean and had a very nice layout. The bathroom was also very large and clean. The room, however, is in need of updating/renovation. The first addition I would suggest is a flat screen LCD TV. What did I like best? Friendly Staff; Location; Free Wireless Internet What did I like least? Old school TV (need an LCD with HD); inaccessibility of the Starbucks

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: EvergreenStater
Reviews.Content: This hotel just off of Michigan Avenue met our needs perfectly. Wife shopped 'til she dropped while son and I went to see the Bears play the Lions. Staff was very friendly and attentive and the room was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location and VALUEVALUEVALUE”
Reviews.Author: Khouse10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott three times this year, and were completely satisfied. Two trips were with children, who stayed in their own room. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and we had no complaints. Nice bedding, lots of soft pillows. The best part about this hotel was the value -- $125 complete per night -- and the location -- near Navy Pier, the mag mile, the art institute and millennium park, State St. It had all we could want, variety of dining options included. Lobby staff very pleasant, helpful concierge.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ouverte
Reviews.Content: The purpose of this trip was the American Girl Store for my daughter, and this was a GREAT location at a fraction of Magnificent Mile prices. I am a Marriott rewards member, so I have been to better.....but I chose the Courtyard because of location, and Courtyard's are pretty consisitant. Front desk staff is VERY helpful, but lobby is small and crowded, elevators slow, but rooms were what I had expected for the price. It all depends on your expectations really. So I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nrlDetroit_Michigan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a spectacular location, right off Michigan Avenue - the Magnificent Mile. The hotel has 2 types of parking facilities - valet with unlimited in and out privileges and self-park in the attached lot. The self-park is the best deal in the city with a . Check-in was smooth and quick. We were thrilled to see a security feature in the elevator whereby the guest MUST swipe their room key in order for the elevator to activate. We have seen this in other hotels and are very appreciative when hotels implement these tools. The room was very large by city standards and spotless. We requested an in-room refrigerator for medical reasons and this was taken care of swiftly. In-room wifi worked perfectly and there were ample electrical plugs for all our electronics. The bed was comfy and even the sofabed provided a good night sleep for my son. The bathroom was fine with good water pressure on the 22nd floor. The only problem we had was the room door not being soundproof. We didn't hear any noise from neighbors, but the hall noise was quite loud at times. We didn't use the business center, but did use the fitness center and pool which were very clean and had a good selection of equipment. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: KBGAub
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location and value, right in the middle of The Magnificant Mile. Hotel was very clean, room was a bit generic, but spacious. The staff at the hotel was outstanding--very helpful. For the money, this hotel cannot be beat. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JamboChris
Reviews.Content: Located close to the Magnificent Mile, the hotel has some of the friendliest staff in any of the places I've stayed in downtown Chicago. My room was on the 14th floor and was very quiet, only the occasional quiet noise of one of the passing ambulances going to the nearby hospitals. Didn't eat in the hotel, it's only one block away from The Corner Bakery where I went for breakfast. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but.......”
Reviews.Author: aerofiend
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a GREAT location. The front desk staff is knowledgeable and accomodating. The rooms are VERY average. We didn't have a trash can and had to REQUEST our toiletries be replinsished daily (3 night stay). The decor is slightly outdated. Our rate was reasonable considering the location. Tip: Try ELeaven for breakfast & lunch.....Excellent Everything. Also, a great Itallian Bistro nearby. Not sure of name. Walk towards DD, make a left at corner. Midway down the block across from strip mall. Inexpensive & Tasty....

Reviews.Title: “Just great.”
Reviews.Author: LucianoSantos
Reviews.Content: No much too say, hotel is great, people are nice, location could not be better, you can walk for almost chicago downtown. Impossible to be wrong choosing this hotel, I also got a good deal, USD 100 daily.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Mile Fun without Mag Mile prices”
Reviews.Author: Pyxisgirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose the Courtyard by Marriott Magnificent Mile this year for a short 3-day trip to Chicago. I'd stayed at the same location last year, and was quite happy with the hotel - I was just as glad to be there this time. First of all, the staff are some of the best staff I've ever encountered at a moderately-priced hotel (our room was $229 on one of the busiest Chicago weekends of the summer). Always friendly and efficient, everyone was quite nice and quick to answer questions or make sure we had the little "extras" we needed during our stay. The lobby is Art Deco in style, with a fireplace, a restaurant (Viand, which has great burgers) and a Starbucks, if you can put up with chain coffee in the event of a coffee emergency ;) Our room was extremely clean, and a super balance between luxury and budget, with comfortable furnishings, good lighting, and slightly swanky bath toiletries. Our particular (very quiet) room on the 23rd floor looked out on the Chicago skyline over Ontario Street, and was the perfect base, being only a block from Michigan Avenue and a short walk to Grant Park and the music fest we attended. We also liked being just a block or so from a wide variety of inexpensive but good food options (Indian Garden, Chinese, Potbelly Sandwich Works, an awesome independent tea cafe, coffee, the Grand Lux, etc.) Another nice plus to this hotel is that the staff will gladly and safely accommodate your luggage should you arrive early (which we did) or depart late (which we also did); this enabled us to change quickly after our train trip in their lobby restroom and spend several hours walking around the city instead of just sitting somewhere having to monitor our luggage until our room opened up. Not sure what the other guests were so disappointed about, as our only "complaint," if you want to call it that, is that the hotel seems to need more elevators, as there was often a wait - but first of all, there probably isn't much they can do about that, and secondly, that's most definitely not enough to void all of the other positives that make up this hotel, with its terrific location, helpful staff, and pleasant rooms. Thanks to everyone at the hotel for a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stlbabe
Reviews.Content: I was able to stay at the Courtyard in June 2009. My sister works for the company so I was able to use her associate's discount. However, the location is a stone's throw from Michigan Avenue. You are right in the middle of all the action. The bar serves a great "grape" martini. The hotel was clean, although the elevators were slow because one was out of order but that didn't bother me. The room was clean, the staff was professional and friendly and the concierge was knowledgeable. We went to the Funky Budda nightclub and if you show your hotel key to the person at the door, you can get in for free $25.00 saving. Also we at a Joe's Crab House and the food was great as well as the maitre d and the service. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms at good location and very friendly staff in the restaurant/bell desk.”
Reviews.Author: VS_trader
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious for a family of 4 and they arranged for extra pillows and towels. However there was no assistance at kerb side with luggage (I had to go in and grab a trolly and then drag it all the way up to my room after check - in). The views from the room was OK (from my room I could see Michigan Av) but nothing spectacular. Restaurant staff for breakfast were friendly and so was bell desk (when we were checking out). At that time they also helped with keeping the luggage in the car. There is some construction going on at the front of the hotel and therefore the pedestrian area is bit tight.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk woke us at 2:27 am!”
Reviews.Author: caseys
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this Courtyard. One thing we like about Courtyards is the fact that they give you Queen beds instead of doubles. We are a family of four with boys entering their teens, so the size of the bed matters to us. These beds are very comfortable. I am very picky about cleanliness and both times we stayed here I have been impressed with how clean the room, hallways, lobby and elevators are. I am a rewards member and the hotel satisfied all my special requests including a feather free room, extra towels, extra pillows and a high floor. Front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful (but keep reading...). The only drawback to the location of this hotel is that is is near the Northwestern Univ. Medical Center and I hear the ambulances during the night. Otherwise it is in a nice neighborhood and it is convenient to walk to shopping on Michigan Ave and there are a lot of restaurants. Okay...here it comes...at 2:27 am, the front desk called our room to tell us that there was a pizza delivery for us. We hadn't ordered any pizza! We had just gotten to bed at 1:00 am because we took in a Broadway show and we were totally exhausted and sound asleep when they called. Needless to say this was quite a disturbance and it was hard for us to get back to sleep. I understand that these mistakes happen, but it did ruin our night. The woman on the phone did apologize and other than this weird event, the rest of our stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “2 Queens in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob96
Reviews.Content: The best part of the room was that it had two queen beds. We were on the 19th floor, had a view of the Mag Mile! The elevators needed keys which made me feel very safe. Didn't try fitness center, business center, pool, or restaurant, but all looked very nice. We paid with Marriott points, but the prices looked good anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Far Below Standard”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: I had booked this property for 3 nights on a business trip to Chicago, thinking that Courtyard was a good choice. Upon arrival, I was surprised to discover that the front was under scaffolding. The front desk was attentive and the room was ready. I got to the room and it had dirty linen and silverware in front of the door. Not a welcome sign. The room felt, well, used and had an unusual odor. The ottman had a large stain on it. Their was 1 bar of soap -- no extra towels, which were requested. The chair at the desk was very uncomfortable to do work. Sleep was difficlut due to others staying out late on the floor. Then I had long waiting time for the elevator, which was over 10 minutes. It was due to the fact that 1 of the elevators was out of service. The lobby was very small and not welcoming. I did complain, they offered a free breakfast. But it was too late,I then decided to check out and move to the Westin---which was like going to a new world at a lower price per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: HELLOWORLD1207
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The room was very clean, the staff were all very nice and accomodating. It was very close to many things to do downtown. My only complaint was that the phones to the hotel were out and we could not get directions, but this was not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: NEMplsTravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the am (7:30) and the staff did not hesitate to check us in. they were up front that the room did not match our request but we could move to another the next day if we wished. We took the room and it was very clean and quiet. I can't say enough good things about the staff. Friendly, courteous and they truly seemed to be interested in making our stay a better one than the "guys down the road". My only suggestion is that staff is better trained on simple directions to public transit. I was looking for the Brown Line and they told me it was about 6 blocks to Clark (which is close) then take a left and it is about 2 blocks away. This was wrong, it was about another 6 blocks. It doesn't seem like a big deal except when you are walking and start to wonder if they meant for us to take a right instead of a left. My only suggestion for the room would be to dramatically improve the lighting in the shower and sink areas. It was like taking a shower in a cave. Some of the other rooms suggested that the rooms needed to be updated. Ours looked updated. Yeah it didn't have a flat screen TV but I'm on vacation not there to watch TV. We booked for $129 a night for a Saturday and Sunday night stay directly through the hotel website. There are many many eating options within a 4 block radius. We ate breakfast at a small diner named Mary's that was on Ohio (go to Ohio take a left towards the Lake and it is on the right side about 1 block down) It was very simple and nothing fancy but it seems hard to find a place that doesn't charge an arm and a leg for a full breakfast in this area. Speaking of the area; the hotel is 1 block from Michigan and is extremely well located. Parking is $28 per night for self park and is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: sdt410
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs some updating, but the value received ($128 per night), the location (one block off Michigan Avenue), and the friendliness of every staff person I encountered makes up for any perceived flaws. The room was clean and comfortable, although on the small side, but had every amenity that I required, including free hi-speed internet. For some reason, the hairdryer was hung in the closet, which I did not discover until almost checking out, but I had brought my own. I especially liked the fact that you have to insert your room key in order to use the elevator. As a single woman traveling alone, safety is a prime consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Price meets Quality”
Reviews.Author: slowee08
Reviews.Content: Located one block from Michigan Avenue, great staff, clean rooms, feeling of safety, and good price of $89 booked via major airline website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: betsy1224
Reviews.Content: When I originally made my reservation at this hotel for a Sunday night stay, I got a $209.95 "Stay for breakfast " rate. About 10 days before my trip to Chicago, I got an email through my Marriott Rewards membership saying that the age 62 and over rate for this hotel was $119, so I changed my reservation to the lower rate. I wouldn't say that this hotel is overpriced at $210, but it's definitely a good buy at $119 because it's clean, the staff pleasant and very well located. It's also very safe, requiring use of your hotel key card to operate the elevator. While the doormen and registration staff are friendly, greeting every guest as s/he enters the hotel, other services are slow. I called the desk to tell them that my TV wasn't working, and it took a second call and a 45-minute wait to get a serviceman to come to my room and fix my TV. I also noticed room service trays outside of rooms for several hours. The exercise room has a decent amount of cardio equipment and lots of free weights, but the heat/AC and ventilation are poorly regulated. Like many hotel exercise facilities, it gets uncomfortably warm after working out for about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business. The hotel had a great location, just steps off of Michigan Ave and all of the shops. The staff was very friendly, and there was never a line at the front desk. Breakfast room service came on time, and internet was included in the rate. The room was very average, had a slightly musty smell, and felt a little "motel-ish". There were some tiny windows that didn't provide a lot of natural light in the room. Overall, I don't have any real complaints, but unless I got a great rate, I would likely look for a better hotel option next time I stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmuemos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on 4/17 because we redeemed our Marriott points so it was free. The location is great - right off of Michigan Avenue - if you are here for shopping it's a great place to be. The hotel is very large and very busy - tons of people in the lobby and we were told the hotel was at full capacity. Check-in was not a problem. Our room was a king size with a view of the city. The room itself was a good size but the interior was outdated and a little worn. The weirdest thing was that the bed wasn't the standard Marriott bed is always so comfortable - the mattress was hard and and there was no duvet, just a thin blanket over sheets. Kinda odd. I have stayed at a lot of Courtyards and it seems like a lot of times there is a trade-off between a great location and a great room. For instance not that long ago I stayed at a Courtyard in New Jersey for work and it was the best looking hotel - newly updated rooms, super clean, and the great beds. Sometimes I think consistency is a problem. Not sure we'd stay here again - there are so many hotels right there at the Mag Mile that I'm sure you could find better. But it was free for us and overall the hotel was fine - just nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms have a musty smell”
Reviews.Author: hello_1979
Reviews.Content: It might be because of the water and after I showered, but the room had a really musty smell throughout our stay. Considering this is a Marriott, I expected the rooms to be fresh. It's in a great location, easy to many places in downtown Chicago. It looks great on the outside as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff make this hotel stand out”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: Marriott consistently delivers on all the basics; rooms are nearly always clean, comfortable and nicely appointed. What makes this particular property stand out is the helpfulness and friendliness of their entire staff. From the minute we arrived (and I had three teenagers in tow) we were greeted warmly and offered information about what to do in the area. The concierge, the front desk staff and even the doorman were all WAY above average and catered to my family rather than ignoring teenagers. It was a wonderfu experience. The location of this hotel is perfect for business or leisure with restaurants, shopping and theaters all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice along the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: travelfoolIndiana
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 3 day stay at the Courtyard. We were extremely satisfied. We stayed in a large 2 Queen room which contained a sofabed and chair. The extra room was nice for a family of 4 to spread out - especially with 2 teenage boys. Room on the 20th floor - so tended to be very quiet. The pool is very small. My sons did not use as it was too crowded. The free internet was appreciated in the room. The hotel is in the midst of converting to wireless in the rooms, so the connection was wired, but not really any type of problem. The free internet access enabled us to continually look-up things we wanted to do/see in Chicago. Starbucks in the lobby was a nice perk. Did not try the restaurant in the hotel (Viand). Did try the West Egg Cafe down the street for breakfast - this is a nice stop for a very filling breakfast - the type that enables you to skip lunch. Great location - right next to Michigan Ave and all kinds of shopping. One of our favorite stops (with those 2 teenage boys) was ESPNzone. A little pricey for gaming and food, but a nice relaxing break for those tired from sightseeing. Parking at the hotel was fine - $28 for self park is CHEAP in this neck of the woods. Easy in and easy pay. Lobby help and concierge were extremely helpful with answering all questions, getting cabs, etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kelly6284
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Magnificent Mile on Ontario. It is my second time staying there. It is a perfect location right off of Michigan Avenue. The staff there is so friendly and just very accomodating. The rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly service, and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: nina85Wichita_Ks
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, and our room was ready to go, the room was clean, there was plenty of towels and toilet paper, and the front desk staff was very helpful. We were withing walking distance of lots of shopping, and plenty of eateries. We were always able to catch a cab, and it was a pretty quite hotel and everything worked properly. The only drawback was we found the lowest rate on Priceline.com, when I called to ask about the lowest rate guarantee I was told that if Priceline had the lowest rate to use priceline... other than that, they accommodated our late check out w/out extra charges, when we asked to have a mini fridge they were happy to oblige. And there were no hidden fees!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this Courtyard, one block off Michigan Avenue. The rooms are nice enough, and relatively quiet. Lighting in the bathroom - shower/toilet area is very flat and dark. Office desk is near impossible to work at using a computer -- the chair is too low even at its highest setting (or desk is too high), something I've mentioned in my Marriott feedback before but still not corrected. I had to sit on a pillow, I mean really.... Viand restaurant is excellent, you really should eat there at least once. I ordered room service breakfast this time using the usual doorknob hanger, it was delivered promptly and hot the next morning. Note to management: when an order form lists prices for a meal and then says "18% delivery charge and $4 service charge is included", that does not have the same meaning as "is added". I think this is poor wording on your part and misleads the guest, since when the bill comes it is meal cost+18%+$4+tax. But to their credit, when I complained about this to the server, she said she would take care of it - and did. My bill was charged the lower amount. Parking is $28/night with hotel discount at the garage next door.

Reviews.Title: “life saver”
Reviews.Author: rebagirl32
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel on January 13th due to a water problem in my home and they made me feel like I was at home. They were very understanding and I was so pleased with the front desk staff they were so warming and always smiling. My kids loved this hotel as well as my husband and I did and I reccommend this hotel for anyone reading right now..disregard every other review and just listen to me.. GREAT HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced for a Chicago Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedWarrior
Reviews.Content: Great location for a weekend in Chicago and a reasonable price. This is a 24 story hotel, not the typical suburban Courtyard Inn layout. This hotel is located a block off MIchigan Av within walking distance of several great restaurants and shopping. The staff is friendly, the rooms are well furnished, very comfortable, and clean. Didn't use room service but it is available and there is an onsight restaurant that looks excellent and a Starbucks for a quick morning coffee and snack.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Somewhat Blah”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September for one night... took my mother out to dinner for her birthday at the wonderful Coco Pazzo Cafe that is less than a block away from this hotel. When I checked in I was told we were getting a junior suite, but the room was not a suite. The next day when checking out I told this to a manager, and he did give me a little bit back, although he pointed out that on my online reservation it did not say I was getting a suite... it said it was an expanded room. Still, he didn't have to refund any money so it was nice that he did. The room was overpriced for what we got. It was nothing more than a typical hotel room, clean, and decorated in a very bland color scheme. I would not have called it an expanded room, even though there was extra seating in the room. It was not spacious by any means. We paid about $270 plus tax for the one night. There was no view, we were just looking out onto a lower level roof and across at some other rooms in a different wing of the building. Actually it was probably good that we weren't facing the street, because the room was very quiet and that neighborhood has several hospitals and sometimes it is possible to hear ambulances if one is on the wrong side of the building. Overall, I was not that impressed with this place and would not stay there again unless there was a really excellent room rate. There are many far better hotels in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: nyjets24
Reviews.Content: Let me 1st say that I stayed for free because I used my Marriott Points... Having said that, this hotel was very centrally located (about a block from Michigan Ave) and was an ideal spot to spend the night in Chicago. We had flown in earlier that day, had lunch at the Hard Rock, and then took a trolley city tour which made periodic stops throughout the city including the Sears Tower, which we also went to the top of. We had dinner at my cousin's in the burbs... The next morning we took some photos of downtown, as the river is only about 4 blocks away and Chicago got another inch of snow overnight, before continuing our trip to Milwaukee & then on to Green Bay. Considering everything, I would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Clean, a View of the Lake for much less than the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: StinkyPeteOhio
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Courtyard in November. We had booked a room at the Palmer House Hilton only to find our accomodations less than desireable. The Courtyard came through to save our weekend with a great rate AND a view of the lake. Everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cram425
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to chicago. The hotel was in a perfect location for everything. We told the front desk that it was our 10 year anniversary and were given a room on the top floor, great customer service. We can't wait for our next visit to the best city.

Reviews.Title: “best time in chicago, with great location.”
Reviews.Author: jdawg2201
Reviews.Content: This was a great location to see chi town. You are only one block from the Magnificent Mile, and about a half mile from the river. This was great for me because you can take public transportion to any event or place you want. The room was your average Marriott, but i must admit the pillow where very soft. The room was very clean, the staff was very helpful on getting to attactions. now the only two bad things. the bar in the lobby was over priced and the drinks where not very well made. The second thing was they do charge you for parking in their own building, that did not bother me much since i took the CTA every where, but for thou who must have a car beware. over all i loved the location and would recomend it to anyone wanting to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: PMFC
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Courtyard Marriott and the staff at this hotel are cheerful and smiling with nothing being too much trouble for the gusts.Also the location is just excellent for everying you want to do.The breakfast choice is also great at Viand and across the road the best steak I have had anywhere at the Capital Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dstickst
Reviews.Content: I spent the night here on business some time ago, and enjoyed my stay. The amenities are clean, crisp, and well-maintained. While I can't really recommend this hotel on those merits alone, it's the location that makes this the place to stay. My room was on the 15th floor and faced the lake, so I had a magnificent view of the lake drive and beach. It's especially entrancing in the evenings, when the street lights and the blur of passing cars make for beautiful reflections off the water. The hotel is also 2 blocks away from the (undeservingly) famous Ditka's, right across the street from the mall and a short hop away from a number of great attractions. I'd say that if you can get it on a deal, go for it. Otherwise there are other hotels in the Windy City that'd make for a better bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and Excellent hotel. Noisy though.”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent location for sightseeing, shopping, and restaurants. We stayed for 4 days and never used our car once. We either walked, took the bus, and even used the water taxi once. The hotel was nice and the staff very helpful (as always with Marriott hotels). The only one complaint is the noise. Being right downtown off of Michigan Ave is NOISY at night. Constant horn honking and sounds of sirens all night. Had a hard time sleeping. Other than that, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: 1/2 block off Michigan Mag Mile. Clean, modern, quiet, and comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly. $28 a day to park in adjoining garage (with $7 discount from hotel). $20 extra per day for a room rate that included a terrific bfast buffet for 2 adults and our daughter. This hotel is also within easy walking distance of Navy Pier, Hancock Building, Chicago River, and lots of great places to eat (Gino's East for Pizza!). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: kristen252
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard for three nights in July and absolutely loved it. The location couldn't be better- it's right next to the Magnificent Mile and within walking distance of the John Hancock Center, Navy Pier, and lots of other great attractions. The room was very spacious and clean. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The parking was reasonable compared to other hotels. If you come with a car, I do recommend just leaving your vehicle in the garage and walking or taking public transportation wherever you go. It would be a nightmare to find parking wherever you go, not to mention expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Chicago !”
Reviews.Author: MrSilk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard over the July 4th weekend and it was fantastic! Perfect location-within half block of Michigan Ave and ten million restaurants, all in a SAFE walking distance. For the price, you can't go wrong when in Chicago. The rooms were good,beds great, prompt maid service,good view. But the best part was the staff. Never, and I mean never, have I met a nicer ,more helpful bunch of people at any hotel in my life! It was like you were at a small bed and breakfast, not a big hotel in a large urban area. "Big Anthony" the doorman was so very helpful with all the questions we bombarded him with every time we left the front door. He always was very helpful with a big smile. The front desk was the same way- very courteous and polite. Check in and out was a breeze-- and there was lots of action going on with people coming and going. I was very impressed with the establishment and HIGHLY recommend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: gointochile
Reviews.Content: Found a great rate for this hotel via Travelzoo and didn't have to purchase ahead. The location was wonderful. A block from Mag Mile and restaurants, walking distance to Hancock Center, River North, Lakeshore Dr., and Millenium Park/Loop. Short cab ride to Old Town. Always people around. Also near bus routes. We were able to walk almost everywhere (and nap in between:)). We left our cell phone in the cab on the way there and the front desk and concierge staff could not have been more helpful in trying to track it down (subsequent cab passenger retrieved it and called us). Our room on the top floor had a great view, was clean and had a modern decor and very comfy bed. Carpet needed some cleaning but room was otherwise good and had a sofabed. We were by the elevator but noise was minimal. Corner Bakery nearby for breakfast along with a small Starbucks. Free internet connection was great. Would definitely go again for the rate we got.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: DCBuffalo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights on business and was thoroughly satisfied. The location off of Michigan Avenue is so convenient that I never bothered to take a taxi or train anywhere. The location is very convenient to the Magnificent Mile and the Loop. Even the walk to Navy Pier wasn't too bad since it the weather was nice! The rooms are the standard Courtyard fare. Quiet room (at least it was quiet on the 23rd floor), Good beds, hot water, acceptable wired internet speeds. Very friendly staff too, although I've come to take that for granted at White Lodging Properties. I ate dinner one evening at Viand, the restaurant downstairs, and was pretty pleased. However, I'd recommend Coco Pazzo Cafe across the street for a more relaxed and less-pretentious atmosphere. Although you'll end up paying a pretty penny to stay downtown, I thought this property was a very good value for either business or leisure travel, especially given the more expensive competition nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: dawnww
Reviews.Content: We stayed Tuesday--Friday, and loved this location. Our room was large and very clean with comfortable beds, and although located right next to the vending machines and ice machine, it was incredibly quiet. The staff, though busy was attentive, with the doormen being especially good. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danaides001
Reviews.Content: We were literally blown in with the snow. The doorman was very helpful the entire weekend. The front desk attendants were always available and helpful as well. There is a nice bar for relaxing and a fire was always burning in the lobby fireplace. Everyone was very warm and friendly. We were there for a three day weekend to visit the Museum of Science and Industry and the Art Institute with our 14 year old son. Our room was clean on arrival and every evening on our return. We requested extra towels daily and they were provided. We had no problems with noise during the night and set out every morning to shop and see the sights. We walked from our hotel to the Wrigley building where we enjoyed fireworks over the bridge. Overall we will definitely book this hotel again on a return trip to the windy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Courtyard Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: travellover524
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Chicago. We had a wonderful time and our stay at the Courtyard Magnificent Mile more than met our expectations. We arrived at the hotel at 9:00 a.m. to see if they could check our bags and we could begin exploring the city. To our pleasant surprise, they had a room available for us that had exactly what we requested and let us go ahead and check in. The day of checkout we had a very late flight and they were nice enough to lock up and store our luggage all day long while we had the great experience of attending a Cubs game at the famous Wrigley Field! Everyone was helpful and friendly at the hotel and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DaveySF
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel for business and think this is a great hotel - staff is very professional and the property and rooms are very clean and well kept. The location is excellent - it is just a block away from the Magnificient mile and close to restaurants and sights. With my stay this time, I noticed this hotel has become a totally smoke- free hotel - great for us non smokers. For smokers, there is a dedicated area in outside front of the hotel for smoking. This is also one of the few hotels that actually don't bother you or try to enter your room when you place a "do not disturb" sign on your door. Overall, great hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for location, go there!”
Reviews.Author: ZorglubWaterloo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many different hotels donwtown Chicago, and it was our first time in this one. Overall we have been very satisfied. Let's be honest, the rooms/furniture/bathroom are much less nice than other hotels like the Hampton Inn or other well-rated downtown hotels, but this one is one block from Michigan Avenue.Location is perfect, and we found a rate on Marriott's websiste @ $128 a night, special weekend rate, so who would complain for this price in the heart of Chicago??? Of course, for those who are not used to Chicago, do not forget to add $28 per night for the parking. So really the rate is $156, but if you compare, it is on the bottom range of the average. Staff is very friendly, they gave a teddy bear to our little boy. Very good breakfast, great buffet, although $14 per person. The rooms are very basic, do not expect any good level of details, but usually you do not spend that much time in your room in such a city, so this is not so important. Very quiet as well, although it is on a high traffic street, noise insulation is pretty good. Very satisfied, best quality/price level we have tried so far in this area of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: devandmisc
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at this Courtyard location for the last four years. We come from all over and "do" a Chicago weekend at least once a year. This Courtyard location is by far our favorite Chicago hotel choice. It's reasonably priced with an awesome location. The rooms are clean and quiet. Self-parking in the attached garage is only $28/night versus the usually $40+. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. There are two queen beds in the rooms instead of two fulls, which makes sleeping for a family of four alot easier. The bar/restaurant is very nice, and can be pricey, but we normally book our rooms to include breakfast - so it's not an issue. I wouldn't eat here if it wasn't included, as there are so many good choices to be had for less money within walking distance (The Grand Lux is only a block away). The only thing that I would say is a negative, is that there is no hot tub in the pool area. The pool is on the 10th floor, and the kids enjoy it, but the adults in our group would be happier if there were a hot tub - there's not. But who goes to Chicago to swim??

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Pookerpug
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Silver Rewards member and have stayed at numerous Marriott's. I would rate this one just average for the category 5 that it's listed as. Check-in went smoothly although the staff member was not overly friendly. We were able to have a refrigerator delivered to the room and it came immediatley which was great. The room we stayed in was pretty small or at least not layed out well given the furniture that was in it. The TV was located to the side of the bed versus at the foot of the bed so it was very uncomfortable to try and lay in bed and watch a movie and the basketball game. The pool was very small and it did not appear there was a hot tub so we ended up not using the facilities even though we had brought our suits. We generally always use the pool. We stopped in the restaurant to ask for a fork to go with a dessert we had brought back to the room and it literally took her 10 minutes to come back with a fork and then she ended up taking it off a table right next to the hostess station. We wanted to make dinner reservations and the concierge said it was too early and to come back at 1. So at 1 we came back and again she said it was too early (because we forgot to change our clocks to accomodate the time change). I have never had that experience. Generally they would take the information and when the time came would make the reservation and then either leave a message on the room phone or send up a card which indicated the reservation time & confirmation. To have to keep stopping back at the desk was an inconvienence that we should have been able to entrust to the concierge to handle. The benefit was the location. If you are interested in being on Michigan Ave for shopping this is only 1/2 blk off the mile. The JW was on the mile and we did go in but the lobby was under construction. We have stayed at the Renaissance at 1 W. Wacker and I would highly recommend that hotel...it's not on the Mile but is still near lots of great restaurants and shopping. The hotel experience was much nicer, although I suppose it should be given that it's a category 6. I felt the staff was more attentive and friendly as well. In closing, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Courtyard but know that it's just an average 5 category.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mamiya22
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel stay Dec 17-21. Excellent service from doorman, Sith. Room equipped with double queen sized beds that were very comfortable. Room attendant very flexible in cleaning times. Room climate control was precise. Iron, board and hair dryer conveniently stored in closet. Only drawback would be internet in room was wired to a very short cord, wireless internet in lobby work area only. Business center in hotel lower lobby fully equipped with 3 computers and printers including a fax machine. Hotel is walking distance to AMC movies 3 blocks, one block off of Michigan Ave and all the excellent department stores. Access to Navy pier, Water tower Plaza, John Hancock Building, Museums all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, no-hassle service”
Reviews.Author: Mtgurel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week. The front desk and concierge people were extremely helpful. The information they gave about restaurants turned out to be spot on. The Viand restaurant in the hotel was reasonably priced and the food was nice. Rooms were clean & large. Asked for a different room when our son came to stay with us and was accomodated within minutes at no extra charge. The fitness center and pool were adequate. The location was perfect and within walking distance of almost every attraction including the beach. This was our fourth hotel stay in Chicago and we would definitely stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: jwachh
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Courtyard on Ontario St. We were just 1 block off of Michigan Ave. about halfway between the river and the watertower. What a GREAT LOCATION! We were in easy walking distance of just about everything. We did use a cab to go to the Shedd Aquarium though. The hotel was very clean, and our room large and comfortable. I was also very impressed by the friendly and courteous staff. There is a Starbucks right off the lobby which we used daily. We also had good experiences at the nearby Grand Luxe Cafe, Gino's East Pizza and Portillo's. In addition, there is a Trader Joe's within a block or so,which is a great place to pick up bottled water or some snacks at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KirkHarrod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, quiet and comfortable. It is in a great location. Nearby in walking distance is Portillo's Hot Dogs, Gino's East, Giordanos, Al's #1 Italian Beef, Garrett's Popcorn, Navy Pier, Water Tower area, groceries, gourmet groceries, movie theater, bowling alley, and lots of shopping. Parking is adjacent and $28/ day with In/Out priviledges. Did not eat at the hotel but the menu looked good. Swimming pool and gym are onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: AZTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights over a weekend for business. It was a great location close to everything downtown. Their rates were more reasonable then some other hotels. I had some minor problems with the internet access but was able to get what I needed in the business center. The staff was helpful with downtown information. I also got a good pizza recommendation to go to Uno down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sdallen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Chicago last night. I thought I would leave a quick review because before I book a hotel, I read lots of reviews and they help me soo much. Anyways, the hotel was wonderful. Location! Location! Location! it's a block from Michigan Ave and just close to everything. The attached parking garage was $28.00 for 24hrs with in/out priveleges. Everything was really clean and comfortable. I would definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Place”
Reviews.Author: lemons1
Reviews.Content: We booked directly through their website, and found the rate as good as or better than the discount sites. Frankly, I think one is treated better that way and more apt to be upgraded. Arrived at the desk ten minutes after the terrible windstorm that came through the last weekend in August, having parked in the garage that is on the lower floors of this building (a very narrow garage; strongly advise not trying it after an evening of drinking...) and were graciously upgraded to one of the little suites when we said we would like a room with - well, a little more room. Good bed, good shower, very clean, very quiet. Affable front desk staff, pleasant doorman. The location is fabulous; this is a great neighborhood for walking. We didn't have dinner reservations, but managed to get into Tru, which is a block and a half north, and for those looking to eat late, they were seating people after 10 p.m., although it is waaaay not a budget eatery. (Very expensive, but delicious and a heaven for dessert lovers.) The garage has in-and-out privileges once you manage the rather odd ticket system included in the $28-a-day price. We had a wall sconce bedside lamp that didn't work, and it was replaced within an hour. Our coffee maker didn't work, although we didn't discover it until 2 days into our stay, and it never did get replaced despite a couple of requests. That's our only quibble. I wish I could find this size room and this kind of rate in New York City. Chicago has gotten more expensive over the years and is closing in on NYC when it comes to hotel and restaurant costs, but this spot offers good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very fabulous front desk”
Reviews.Author: holamexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard on Marriott Reward points. We were to check in on Sunday. We arrived at around 9:45am just to drop off our bags before a Cub game. The courteous gentleman at the front desk indicated that we could check in then and go up to our room! We were very happy!!! After celebrating in Wrigleyville, we headed back! I ordered room service and was very happy with my choice of ravioli. Very different and very good. Not the typical ravioli. Great Stay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: SG4prez
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at this property for four nights. It's moderately priced (for Downtown Chicago). When I travel, I always try to stay in a place that is centrally located and this property certainly fits that description. Just half a block from the Magnificent mile and 5 blocks to the West of the navy pier, the walking distances are very manageable. The red subway line is about 6 blocks away(about 10 minutes) and if you take a bus on Michigan Av to the subway, it's just steps away. The hotel itself is not luxurious but very clean. It has one restaurant/bar that was usually busy and a very helpful concierge & front desk staff. A great feature I loved was 3 computers in the office center for use free of charge, internet & printer included. My only quibble was the room we ordered, a king bed with a sofa bed in a seperate room. There is no door or any kind of covering whatsoever between the "bedroom" and the sofa area so opposite sex persons staying in the same room or parents with small children might want to be aware of this. Check with the hotel first if this is important to you. But otherwise, this is a good choice to stay in downtown Chicago if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rhkfreespirit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a block off Michigan Ave so you can't beat the location in downtown Chicago. It is a "typical" Marriott Courtyard (that has not been given the update)....hotel furniture, TV on dresser, desk and chair, small bathroom with shower and the sink outside the bathroom. The bed is a bit updated with white sheets but unfortunately, is not the new "Marriottt bed". The lobby area is updated and the staff very friendly and accommodating. Clean and sufficient for a night's stay with a much lower price per night than other hotels in the area .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: jayjaymag
Reviews.Content: My sister, daughter and I spent two nights here because we snagged tickets to Oprah. We checked in with no problems a bit early at 2 . When we got to our room we realized that the two queen beds would be small for both my adult daughter, my sister and I so we called down to the front desk to request a roll away bed. The front desk informed us that extra beds in the rooms were against code in Chicago and that someone would be up shortly with keys to another room. . About ten minutes later the bell captain came up with our keys and offered to take our luggage to the new room but was gracious when we said we really didnâ€™t need help since we each only had a carry on. The new room had a sofa bed and two queen beds in it on the 22nd floor. It was perfect, large and spacious with a sink outside of the bathroom which is always a plus with three women in one room. We did have to bother the desk twice more for extra towels and to find out the location of the hair dryer and they were quick and courteous. (The hair dryer is in the top shelf of the closet behind the iron.) The only drawbacks I could see is that wireless internet was only in the lobby where I saw numerous travelers huddled over their laptops. The pool was also shallow and only about two strokes long. The bar offers Tapas which members of my party did not care for so I canâ€™t report on the food there but breakfast was decent at 13.00 but the 9% tax brings lots of things higher than advertised in this city. The doormen were terrific. No matter what time of day, someone was on duty to get us cabs or tell us how to get to different sites. They were always cheerful and upbeat. One was also very helpful to my daughter. When her prepaid Express van (booked through Expedia.com with her air fare) to the airport took off without her; he snagged her a ride with a great private driver who got her to the airport in time even though there was a massive backup on the main roads. In all this is a nice hotel located near lots of shops and about a mile from the Navy Pier. In the summer, there is a free trolley that will take you to almost any location in the city. It runs from May to Labor Day about every ten minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - not The Talbott”
Reviews.Author: secnin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Chicago. Usually stay at The Talbott on Delaware but opted for hotel closer to theatre and with a pool. Room was clean, very small. Staff was friendly not necessarily helpful when it came to suggesting late nite dinner (10pm). Everything was closed at 10pm in the neighborhood. Overall an okay stay but will return to The Talbott next time. You can't beat the service and accomodations for the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, minor quirks”
Reviews.Author: arkham
Reviews.Content: PROS: Wonderfull facility, friendly and helpful staff, very comfortble beddings and linens, good location, secure property. CONS: Pool too small. Pool had band-aids and other refuse stuck in drain edge which should have been cleaned up daily. No hair dryer in rooms, even though they had irons and coffee makers. Breakfast not included. Free internet is wired, not wireless, in guestrooms. Except for these minor quibles, the place is well worth it, even though it is not the least expensve of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Courtyard!!”
Reviews.Author: leavingtally
Reviews.Content: I must preface by saying that I did not pay for this hotel stay, so I can not speak to the value of the hotel. However, for a Courtyard this hotel exceeded all my expectations. Definitely the nicest Courtyard I have stayed at. The location was excellent, basically on Michigan Avenue. We were in a King Suite on the 23rd floor that overlooked Magnificent Mile. The room was clean and in an updated dÃ©cor. The staff was friendly and attentive. Housekeeping did a great job. Never ate at restaurant, but had a drink at the bar (free drink coupon was provided by the very friendly porter during our check-in). I would defiantly consider this hotel a four-star property!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: brad120
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is very kid friendly. There are restaurants very close by. The pool is nice, and the staff is great. The Magnificent Mile is just yards away. Dont' miss "The Indian Garden" down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodations for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Audrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on June 4. I'm a big fan of the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificient Mile but the rates were very high - must have been a large convention in town. I had not stayed at the Courtyard Chicago Downtown before but the location seemed good. Overall I was pleased with my stay. PROS (mainly for the business traveler) - Free highspeed internet - "Business Center" open 24 hours on the basement level - not fancy but there are two computers and a printer. This was perfect for printing a boarding pass and printing a document I neeeded for a meeting the next morning - Clean rooms CONS - The bed was one of the worst I've had at a Marriott. No cushy matress cover. Very uninviting. - Because I had very little time in the morning and because the Starbucks downstairs had been closed the day before "due to problems with air conditioning," I decided to order room service for breakfast. I decided the healthy choice of yogurt, granola and fruit would be good. I would have felt like I got more for my money if I had chosen something else. I literally received a small yogurt (from a multi pack), a 1/4 cup of granola and a small plate of fruit. I know room service is a rip-off but this was very disappointing for $21 (this did include a small pot of coffee). Overall the stay was good but next time I will return to Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificient Mile if I can find better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: marleney
Reviews.Content: We picked the Courtyard because of a $99 special on Travelzoo. The hotel was very nice, clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Starbucks in the lobby, which was nice. We checked in 3 hours early with no problem. I had requested a room on a high floor and got room 2008, on the 20th floor. King size bed, sofa with pull out bed, desk & chair. Nice and comfortable, and the window size was the length of the outside wall with a pretty good city view. We ordered room service once, it was ok, but overpriced in my opinion. Ice & soda machines on each floor are nice. Shower was perfect, good water flow, and plenty of hot water. Toilet and tub in seperate area from sink. Location was great, one block off Michigan and a bus stop we used a lot. Lots of restaurants, very expensive stores, and a Dunkin Donuts and White Hen store around the corner. Concierge staff were SO helpful with advice on buses to take and where to get off, as well as offering us free tickets to a play. The only negative was that they advertise on the Marriott site there is free internet on the tv. They have limited access that is free, mostly weather, stocks and news sites. We went ahead and paid the 9.99 access fee, but none of the sites we wanted would load for us. (Sites like google, yahoo, etc.) Not even Trip Advisor would load! Not a big deal, but thought I would mention it, cause we were looking forward to the internet access to check email, and we couldn't. All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for first visit”
Reviews.Author: shadypines
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chicago and I am glad that I chose the Courtyard. It was central and near wherever we wanted to be. We did a lot of walking. Amongst our ramblings around the city we visited all the Marriott brands in Chicago to compare and were happy about our choice. It suited our budget on Point conversion. However the next time we would like to stay at the Renaissance because we were very impressed with the river view, rooms, the staff and the wonderful lounge area. The Courtyard welcome was very business like without the usual friendly smile. I noticed that most Courtyard welcomes are like this. They could adapt to visitors who are leisure travellers and not running for the next meeting. The lady kept on insisting that the room she was giving us was the one she would choose herself. I appreciated her concerns and she did put us on a higher floor away from a large group of school kids. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable and the view was acceptable. The Breakfast was great. The one aspect of Courtyard I hate is the infernal airconditioner which is a separate unit in the room. We always find it very loud and intrusive, and at times non-functioning. Why the Marriott group keeps on building hotels with the outdated air conditioners beats me. We found a wonderful restaurant in Illinois St. called NAHA. The food is out of this world. It was a dining experience. One the the most pleasant we have had in years. World class cuisine. I believe that Carrie is the owner Chef ex. 4 Seasons Beverly Hills. What a find! Chicago is a wonderful city, we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MyFamilyAgent
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to everything we needed. We rode the bus back from the Bulls game, shopped a bit and returned with our goodies. Walked to the House of Blues and drove to Blue Man Group. We had five in a room and fit because we had queen-size beds. Handy Starbucks in the lobby and discount parking attached. Basing the cost on the convenience, this was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cleanest hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Soda100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and had a great time in Chicago. The hotel is located wonderfully close to Michigan Ave shopping, the free bus to the Navy Piers, the bus to the Shedd Aquarium and other museums, and there are lots of nice, medium expensive places to eat in walking distance. The room is a little smaller that we would have liked, and ther window was teeny-- we found that the drapes concealed a small window and lots of wall. Outside of being a bit cramped, our room was comfortable and and utterly immaculate. This hotel is amongst the cleanest I've ever stayed at, and even the public areas, which can't be easy to keep clean (like the stairs and the lobby) are totally spick and span. The bathroom is nicely done, comfortable, though it could use another towel rack, we found we were draping towels everywhere. The beds were comfortable, the business center had good net acceess and we could print up our boarding passes for our flights, very handy! I never got to the exercise room (walking around Chicago is plenty of exercise!), but the restaurant is good, and the desk staff is very helpful and friendly with tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVisitor
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to chicago and we wanted to visit during the holidays. Since we had no past visits to draw on, we pretty much went with an "affordable" price listing compared with the other hotel listings. Our hotel was everything we had hoped for. The parking was on site and it was very easy to park our own car and walk a few steps to the lobby. The check in process was pleasant and we were able to go directly to our room even though we arrived a few hours before checkin and we were offered a choice of two rooms to chose from. Our room couldn't have been more pleasant. The beds were better than we had at home and everything was extremely clean! A nice couch and desk and chair were appreciated. The hotel lobby was also inviting and offered several seating arrangements for lounging. Upon exiting and returning we were always greeted like old friends. The employees seemed to really enjoy working there. The attached restaurant offered a wonderful breakfast buffet for $13! That was a very pleasant suprise! The location was perfect for shopping. We saw the Festival of Lights parade and fireworks and were only steps away from our room. We were able to unload packages and set back out again and again. I now know that I have the perfect place to stay and look forward to the possibility of making this a yearly tradition! You should too!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: ceannain
Reviews.Content: We are just back from four nights at this hotel. My two friends and I shared a large room with two large double beds and plenty of room for all the shopping we did! We had the American girl package (thou we are all in our 30s) and got cookies and milk every night. The location is perfect , just off Michigan Ave and we walked everywhere. We never ate in the hotel for some reason but the menu read well. There's a Starbucks in the lobby which we found great after coming in after a long day..we needed a shot of caffeine to go out again at night.Concierge was very helpful with reservations and recommendations. A great place for breakfast is West eggs ,about two blocks east, out of hotel turn right and walk for two minutes. We also went to the House of Blues for Sunday Gospel brunch,it cost about $40 and was very short , but a good experience for us. The Architectural river tour was brilliant but have heard it depends on the guide. You get a great view of Chicago that you dont get walking. Also recommend going to the Hancock tower for drinks...great view! All in all LOVED Chicago...def my kinda town. I'll be back and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: zdersw
Reviews.Content: My mother and I got this place for $80 on priceline, and it was a fantastic deal. The hotel is nothing fancy but it was clean and spacious in a good quiet location. The restaurant downstairs is great.

Reviews.Title: “My kinda hotel before heading down Route 66”
Reviews.Author: grahamkuk
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night after a 9 hour delay flying over from UK and we received a warm reception on arrival. Our request was for a twin/twin/sofabed room high up with a front facing view. We were on the 21st floor but none of these rooms face the front - we could just see the tops of the Sears Tower ariels sticking above the other nearby towers. We ate out for all our meals including breakfast - tip of the day is turn left towards the Michican Avenue and not right towards the Lake otherwise you'll be hungry. There is an amazing McDonalds a few blocks west - huge fancy thing unlike any other you will see in the world - it a special to mark their 50th anniversary and worth a visit. Everywhere you will want to see downtown is within walking distance so we didn't hire our car until time to drive Route 66. The hotel has an integrated public mutlistorey car park and you get a much reduced rate for staying at the hotel. The kids & I appreciated the free high speed internet service - two PCs you can use so don't worry if you forget your laptop like I did. Nice lounge bar and a few tables on the pavement outside (or side walk as you call it in the US). Nice Califonian red by the glass though I can't remember the label. Not many sidewalk cafes in Chicago, shame. Friendly staff (including some Brits), fresh fruit at reception and one day we even had free miniature Hersey bars though I still don't like them, it ain't chocolate. Our family party of 5 managed to share the single bathroom. We enjoyed our 3 night stay here and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: ondroad
Reviews.Content: Great Location! 1 block from Michigan Ave., Starbucks in the lobby, & donut shop across the street. Walking distance to everything. Rooms are nice & staff is very accomadating. We would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Kimbmd
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel! I have never stayed at a Courtyard before and only booked this one because the other nearby Marriott (where my meeting was held) had no availability. I don't regret the 1 1/2 block walk at all! I had stayed at the other hotel earlier in the summer and was not altogether pleased. The room was nice although not huge. It was quiet. The bonus was the restaurant, "Viand". It is actually a "restaurant/bar." As it was a Saturday night there were quite a few people but not crowded. However, it was not noisy nor was the service slow. Our server was very pleasant, knowledgable and prompt. To beat all of that, the prices were very reasonable! It was after 7:30 when we arrived so we didn't want more than a light meal. I got a very good BBQ turkey wrap and fries for $12 and my Mother got a very large burger and fries for $10. Breakfast the next morning was the same value. Two eggs, meat, hash browns and toast for $7! (To compare, the same meal at the other hotel where we stayed this trip was $14!) It was so nice to be able to eat in a big city hotel restaurant that wasn't so overpriced. There was free high speed internet access in the room. Which is something I haven't found in many large cities as it is usually at least $10 per day. That is a huge ripoff considering that one is usually paying well over $200 per night for the room even at a discounted/group rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel no surprises”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: Standard Marriott hotel with the only hassle being a high rate for the night (one night $330.00). Great location about one block from Michigan Avenue and parking garage attached to the hotel. Breakfast in the morning had a 20 minute wait to I walked one block east to West Egg Cafe but there are plenty of restaurants in the area if that is a frequent issue. Quick Internet and fairly good selection of cable channels. Warning there are two hotels in the downtown area so make sure you are driving to the correct location.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but a little cramped”
Reviews.Author: jah39a
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a mini suite type room. This had a half wall separating the sitting area from the bedroom, but there was so much furniture that it all felt very cramped. When the sofabed was open, you could only squeeze by. The hotel has a small indoor pool, very cold water, no hot tub. The Fitness room was modest, with a few weight machines and 3 treadmills. If you use the adjacent restaurant for breakfast, ("Viand") skip the small buffet and order from the menu, it was much better than the buffet. Parking in the garage is $30 per day, but ask for a discount ticket at the front desk and get $4 off. Front desk service was friendly and helpful, and the location is very good, though the small lobby always seemd crowded and a little chaotic. The hotel was very clean and well kept. There are several other Marriott properites downtown including the regular Marriott and the Rennaisance. They have better facilities overall, and are often competitively priced.
